0.title: 19-yr-old who tracks Musk's jet claims he has found Zuckerberg's new aircraft
0.article_body: Jack Sweeney, the 19-year-old who tracks Elon Musk's jet, on Wednesday tweeted, "We've found Mark Zuckerberg's jet N68885. Numerous trips point it being his." Sweeney shared a picture of the aircraft. In February, Sweeney began tracking and sharing updates on what he said was Zuckerberg's private jet. In April, he said the aircraft was no longer being used by Zuckerberg.

1.title: IMD issues orange alert in 12 of 14 districts in Kerala amid heavy rains
1.article_body: India Meteorological Department (IMD) has issued an orange alert in 12 of 14 districts in Kerala amid heavy rains. The alert was issued in all districts except Thiruvananthapuram and Kollam for Thursday. The cyclonic circulation over northern Tamil Nadu and adjoining areas would lead to isolated very heavy rainfall in several parts of Kerala, the state Disaster Management Authority said.

2.title: Sri Lanka CID interrogates 4 MPs over violence during protests
2.article_body: Sri Lanka Police's Criminal Investigation Department (CID) on Wednesday questioned four Members of Parliament (MPs) over the violence amid protests owing to the economic crisis. Many protesters were allegedly attacked by government supporters in Colombo. The CID recorded statements of ex-ministers Rohitha Abeygunawardena and CB Rathnayake and MPs Sahan Pradeep and Sanjeeva Edirimanna.

3.title: Getty Images to launch NFTs derived from its library of 465 mn images
3.article_body: Getty Images has entered into an agreement with Candy Digital to develop a diverse portfolio of NFT products and collections. The NFTs will be derived from the platform's library of "more than 465 million images", including over 135 million analogue images from Getty Images' photographic archive. Many of the analogue archival photographs have never been seen before by the public.

4.title: No improvement in J&K's security after Article 370 abrogation: Omar Abdullah
4.article_body: National Conference Vice President Omar Abdullah on Wednesday said there has been no improvement in the security situation in Jammu and Kashmir following the abrogation of Articles 370 and 35A. While reacting to the targeted killings in the union territory, the former J&K CM said, "In this week, three such killings took place. After every few weeks, this phenomenon restarts."

5.title: Speak truth in Cong and big leaders will defame you: Hardik Patel
5.article_body: A day after resigning from Congress, Hardik Patel criticised the party and said that the strategy of big leaders in Congress is to defame the one who speaks the truth. "There are discussions in party that people will vote for Congress when they get bored," he added. "I decided to leave party not with sadness but courage," Hardik further said.

6.title: Doctor arrested for running sex determination centre in Ludhiana
6.article_body: An Ayurvedic lady doctor was arrested on Wednesday for allegedly running an illegal sex determination centre in Ludhiana's Rishi Nagar. A raid was conducted following complaints that people from across Punjab and Haryana were getting sex detection tests done at the centre, health department officials said. The doctor had been running the centre for around one-and-a-half years, officials stated.

7.title: US charges 1 American, 4 Chinese intel officers with spying
7.article_body: The US charged an American citizen and four Chinese intelligence officers with spying on Chinese dissidents, human rights leaders, and pro-democracy activists residing in the country. American citizen, Wang Shujun, was arrested on March 16 and will be arraigned at a later date, but the four officials of China's Ministry of State Security remain at large, US Justice Department said.

8.title: J&K separatist leader Yasin Malik convicted in terror funding case in Delhi
8.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir separatist leader Yasin Malik has been convicted in 2017 terror funding case by an NIA court in Delhi after he pleaded guilty, ANI reported. The court also sought an affidavit from Malik regarding his financial assessment and asked NIA to submit a report related to his financial assessment. Argument on sentence will take place on May 25.

9.title: Ambala man kills 52-yr-old neighbour with hammer following argument
9.article_body: A 52-year-old woman was allegedly murdered by her neighbour after she asked him to repair his shed in Ambala’s Saha town on Wednesday. According to the deceased woman’s son, the 28-year-old accused hit the victim’s head with a hammer following an altercation with her regarding the shed. The accused managed to escape.

10.title: China building 'larger' bridge on Pangong Tso lake; satellite image released
10.article_body: China is constructing a "larger" second bridge on Pangong Tso lake which is capable of carrying military vehicles and armoured columns, according to satellite imagery and people familiar with the development. The new bridge is being built from both sides simultaneously. The Pangong Tso has witnessed tensions between India and China since May 2020.

11.title: How can RCB qualify for IPL 2022 playoffs?
11.article_body: Fifth-placed RCB will face GT in IPL 2022 tonight. RCB have the worst net run-rate among teams still in contention for playoffs spots. RCB will go fourth on the table with a win over GT. However, they'd need MI to defeat DC to advance. If DC defeat MI, RCB would all likely fail to qualify due to inferior net run-rate.

12.title: It's a natural geologic feature: NASA after pic of 'door' on Mars goes viral
12.article_body: After a pic appearing to show a "door" on Mars went viral, NASA's Curiosity Rover tweeted "Some of you have noticed this image I took...Sure, it may look like a tiny door, but really, it's a natural geologic feature!" "It may just look like a door because your mind is trying to make sense of the unknown," it wrote.

13.title: Only Deepika & I were in sarees at Cannes, attracted a lot of attention: Namita
13.article_body: Actress-producer Namita Lal spoke about her experience of visiting the Cannes Film Festival. She said, "The red carpet was just amazing." Speaking about meeting Deepika Padukone, Namita said, "Deepika was dressed in an amazing saree and was looking stunning. I was in a saree too...We were the only two people in a saree and we attracted a lot of attention."

14.title: J&K govt creates ₹500 cr Film Development Fund for 5 yrs
14.article_body: The Jammu and Kashmir government has created Film Development Fund (FDF) of ₹500 crore to be payable in next five years to financially support the development of a vibrant film ecosystem in the valley. According to the Film Policy, the amount will be used for disbursement of subsidies to eligible beneficiaries or film-makers who have applied for the same.

15.title: Rinku Singh tears up as KKR lose to LSG by 2 runs, pics go viral
15.article_body: KKR's Rinku Singh teared up after his team lost to LSG by two runs and failed to qualify for IPL 2022 playoffs. Needing 21 runs to win off the last over, Rinku slammed 18 runs on the first four deliveries before getting caught out on the fifth ball. LSG dismissed Umesh Yadav on the last ball to win the match.

16.title: SC grants interim bail to SP leader Azam Khan in cheating case
16.article_body: Supreme Court has granted interim bail to jailed Samajwadi Party (SP) leader Azam Khan in a cheating case citing "unusual facts" presented before it. SC directed Khan to apply for regular bail before the concerned court within a period of two weeks. The case is related to alleged land grabbing and forgery related to a school in Uttar Pradesh's Rampur.

17.title: Upset over UP govt's order, Mathura lawyers observe strike
17.article_body: After the Uttar Pradesh government issued an order directing all district magistrates to take action against lawyers creating lawlessness in the state's district courts, the lawyers in Mathura observed a strike on Wednesday. The lawyers abstained from work due to the derogatory language allegedly used in the order against the lawyers' community, Bar Association President Ajeet Teharia said.

18.title: Bezos' Blue Origin delays 5th crewed spaceflight over technical issues
18.article_body: Jeff Bezos-owned Blue Origin delayed its fifth crewed spaceflight due to technical issues. The launch was scheduled for May 20. "During our final vehicle check-outs, we observed one of New Shepard's back-up systems was not meeting our expectations for performance," the firm said. Blue Origin's fourth flight landed successfully in March after a 10-minute journey to the edge of space.

19.title: Auto driver killed, woman passenger injured in hit-and-run case in Bandra
19.article_body: A 30-year-old auto-rickshaw driver was killed and a woman passenger travelling in his vehicle was injured after a heavy vehicle hit the three-wheeler in Mumbai's Bandra (West). The incident took place on Tuesday night. While the auto driver's body was found lying on the road in a decapitated state, the injured woman had left the spot in another auto-rickshaw.

20.title: Aurangzeb's tomb shut for 5 days to maintain law and order: Maha Deputy CM
20.article_body: Mughal emperor Aurangzeb's tomb in Aurangabad will remain closed for five days to ensure that the law and order situation in Maharashtra does not get affected, Deputy CM Ajit Pawar said. This comes after a mosque committee in the area tried to lock the place. Notably, Maharashtra Navnirman Sena spokesperson Gajanan Kale had said that the tomb should be destroyed.

21.title: India has become third largest startup ecosystem globally: PM Modi
21.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi in his address to the Yuva Shivir in Gujarat praised India's progress, saying, "Today, India has become third largest startup ecosystem in the world." He also praised India's participation in tackling worldwide challenges. "Today, we are working to build a new India which has a new forward-looking identity, but maintains its ancient traditions," he added.

22.title: 100 red sandalwood logs seized in Andhra Pradesh, 6 smugglers arrested
22.article_body: Andhra Pradesh's Kadapa Police on Wednesday arrested six people for illegally smuggling red sandalwood logs. About 100 logs of red sandalwood weighing 2 tonnes were seized from the accused, said Kadapa Superintendent of Police (SP) Anburajan. According to police, the apprehended persons were involved in illegally transporting red sanders from Andhra Pradesh to Chennai.

23.title: Yogi Cabinet accepts proposal to stop grants to new madrasas in UP
23.article_body: Yogi Adityanath-led Uttar Pradesh Cabinet has accepted a proposal to stop grants to any new madrasas in the state. The old madrasas getting the funds would continue to do so. "The idea is to focus on quality than quantity...we plan to focus on the quality of the existing ones," UP Minister of State for Minority Welfare Danish Azad Ansari said.

24.title: US embassy reopens in Ukraine's Kyiv after nearly 3 months
24.article_body: The US embassy resumed its operations after nearly three months in war-torn Ukraine's Kyiv on Wednesday. The consular operations, however, won't start immediately and a no-travel advisory issued earlier will remain in place, said an official. "We stand proudly with the government and people of Ukraine as they bravely defend their country," said US Secretary of State Antony Blinken.

25.title: Japan to double fiscal support for Ukraine to $600 million
25.article_body: Japanese PM Fumio Kishida said the country will double its fiscal support for Ukraine to $600 million in a coordinated move with World Bank to back the country's near-term fiscal necessities damaged by Russia's invasion. "Our country stands with Ukraine," Kishida added. Japan, a member of the G7, had previously announced $300 million in loans to Ukraine in April.

26.title: N Korea has completed preparations for nuclear test, waiting for best moment: S Korea
26.article_body: North Korea has completed preparations for a nuclear test and is seeking the best moment to carry it out, South Korean lawmaker Ha Tae-keung said citing information from the national spy agency. Earlier, US said it believes there is a "genuine possibility" that North Korea could conduct a nuclear test while President Joe Biden is on his Asia trip.

27.title: Virat Kohli gifts Rashid Khan his bat ahead of their match, Rashid shares video
27.article_body: GT vice-captain Rashid Khan took to Instagram to share a video of him with RCB's Virat Kohli after the latter gifted him his bat ahead of their IPL 2022 clash. "Always a pleasure meeting you...Thank you for the gift," Rashid wrote. Commenting on Rashid's post, SRH pacer Fazalhaq Farooqi wrote, "Two kings of cricket." Meanwhile, presenter Erin Holland wrote, "Superstars."

28.title: Stop printing textbooks with RSS founder's talk: Siddaramaiah to K'taka CM
28.article_body: Reacting to reports of inclusion of RSS founder KB Hedgewar's speech in Karnataka school textbooks, Congress leader Siddaramaiah told Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai to immediately stop the printing of the textbooks. He further asked Bommai to take decision in this regard after discussions with intellectuals and experts. "Do not politicise education for selfish reasons," the ex-Karnataka CM added.

29.title: SC asks UP court not to proceed with Gyanvapi Mosque case today, will hear matter tomorrow
29.article_body: The Supreme Court has asked the trial court in Varanasi not to proceed with the Gyanvapi Mosque case till Friday. The Supreme Court will hear the case at 3 pm tomorrow. Vishnu Shankar Jain, advocate of the Hindu side, told the Supreme Court that senior advocate Hari Shankar Jain is not well and requested it to hear the case tomorrow.

30.title: Russia uses new laser weapons in Ukraine, Zelenskyy mocks 'wonder weapon'
30.article_body: Russia has said it is using a new generation of powerful lasers in Ukraine to burn up drones. Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy mockingly compared news of the lasers to the "wonder weapon" that Nazi Germany unveiled in a bid to prevent defeat in World War II. Russia's move "clearly indicates the complete failure of the invasion", Zelenskyy said.

31.title: Ridiculous: Cathie Wood on Tesla being cut from S&P 500 ESG Index
31.article_body: Ark Invest's Cathie Wood in response to Tesla being cut from the S&P 500 ESG Index, said, "Ridiculous. Not worthy of any other response." Responding to Wood, Musk wrote, "Yup. A clear case of wacktivism." "What I love most about wacktivists is their incredible sense of humour," he wrote in another tweet later.

32.title: How long can you hide truth?: RSS leader on Gyanvapi case
32.article_body: Speaking about the Gyanvapi Mosque case, RSS leader Sunil Ambekar said that facts should be allowed to come out. "Facts are coming out…In any case, truth always finds a way out. How long can you hide it?" Ambekar added. "I believe it's time we put historical facts in the right perspective before society," Ambekar stated.

33.title: Jaipur traffic policeman damages car’s windshield as driver jumps red light
33.article_body: A car’s windshield was damaged as a traffic policeman hit it with a stick after the driver jumped a red light in Jaipur’s Rambagh crossing on Wednesday, police said. A woman and a minor girl were also travelling in the car. Following the incident, a ruckus was created there. "Seven persons were arrested from the spot," a police official said.

34.title: Gyanvapi Mosque video survey report submitted in sealed cover in Varanasi court
34.article_body: The court-appointed Commission that conducted the video survey of the Gyanvapi Mosque complex has filed its report in a sealed cover in the Varanasi court on Thursday. Earlier, the Supreme Court had asked Varanasi District Magistrate to protect the area where the Shivling was claimed to have been found without affecting the right of Muslims to enter mosque and worship.

35.title: You call yourself sh*tposter, maybe you're wiseposter: Bezos to DOGE co-creator
35.article_body: Amazon's Jeff Bezos in response to a tweet by Dogecoin Co-creator Billy Markus said, "Seen you refer to yourself as...sh*tposter but maybe you're mostly just a wiseposter." Markus had tweeted about how Democrats and Republicans could pull more people to their side. Markus thanked Bezos and said he's addicted to dopamine and his tweets are just random thoughts he has.

36.title: Attempt to create panic: WB CM on Maoists posters in Jhargram
36.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee said that the posters put up with names of Maoists in Jhargram district are an attempt to create panic among the people. "Someone has been putting up handwritten posters claiming that it had been done by Maoists," Banerjee added. "There has been a continuous campaign and I think it must be investigated," Banerjee further said.

37.title: Katrina, Alia & I decided we want to do film together: Priyanka on Jee Le Zara
37.article_body: Actress Priyanka Chopra spoke about why she said yes to Farhan Akhtar's project, 'Jee Le Zara', which also stars actresses Katrina Kaif and Alia Bhatt. Priyanka said, "Katrina and Alia are two of the top actresses in the country." "The three of us decided we wanted to do a movie together and partner together to produce it," Priyanka said.

38.title: Shops in Mumbai to use Marathi signboards in Devanagari by May 31: BMC
38.article_body: Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has directed all shops and establishments in Mumbai to predominantly use Marathi signboards in Devanagari script by May 31. While using more than one script, the Marathi-Devanagari script font cannot be smaller than that of other scripts, it added. Liquor shops or bars must not bear the names of legendary personalities and historical forts, BMC stated.

39.title: 65-year-old woman arrested for kidnapping 5-year-old boy in Thane
39.article_body: A 65-year-old woman has been arrested for allegedly kidnapping a five-year-old boy in Maharashtra's Thane district with the aim of selling him. The boy was kidnapped from near his house in Mafatlal slum area in Thane's Kalwa at around 10 pm on May 14. Police traced the woman within 48 hours and handed over the child to his parents.

40.title: Belarus introduces death penalty for 'attempted terrorism'
40.article_body: The Belarusian government has made 'attempted terrorism' punishable by death. President Alexander Lukashenko cleared the amendments to the criminal code, which will come into force on May 29. Earlier, death sentence was reserved for acts of terrorism that resulted in death or murder. Notably, several opposition leaders have been charged with terrorism over anti-government protests in 2020.

41.title: Kerala Cong chief booked for remarks against CM Pinarayi Vijayan
41.article_body: The KPCC President K Sudhakaran was booked by the Palarivattom Police in Kochi for his "dog with broken chain" remark allegedly made on CM Pinarayi Vijayan. The police have booked Sudhakaran under Section 153 of the IPC based on the complaint made by a Democratic Youth Federation of India leader. Notably, LDF has termed Sudhakaran's remark as "highly reprehensible".

42.title: Depp grabbed Amber by hair and whacked her repeatedly in the face: Heard's sister
42.article_body: Actress Amber Heard's sister Whitney Henriquez, while testifying in Johnny Depp's defamation trial against Heard, said Depp once grabbed Amber by the hair and whacked her repeatedly in the face. She said that she witnessed their fight at their penthouse in March 2015. She further claimed that Depp asked her to sign a non-disclosure agreement after the incident.

43.title: 20-year-old dies by suicide after boyfriend blocks her on WhatsApp in Mumbai: Police
43.article_body: A 20-year-old woman allegedly died by suicide at her boyfriend's house in Mumbai after he blocked her number on WhatsApp following an argument with her, police said. Inspector Anil Kadam said police have seized their mobile phones. He added, "Prima facie it appears that the woman was extremely possessive about her boyfriend and her boyfriend was unhappy with this possessiveness."

44.title: Spain's ex-King Juan Carlos to return home after 2-year exile
44.article_body: Spain's ex-King Juan Carlos will return to the country on Thursday after nearly two years in exile in the UAE, the Royal Household said. He had left Spain amid allegations of corruption. But, three investigations against the 84-year-old were dropped in March, paving the way for him to return. Carlos abdicated in 2014 and handed power to his son Felipe.

45.title: US invokes wartime act amid baby formula shortage
45.article_body: US President Joe Biden has invoked the 1950 Defense Production Act to make companies produce vital baby formula ingredients as part of a number of new measures to lessen the ongoing national baby formula shortage. It was first enacted to avoid wartime shortages. The Defense Production Act also lets the President prohibit hoarding and profiteering from certain materials.

46.title: 12-year-old dies in Noida days after trying to imitate Superman
46.article_body: A 12-year-old boy died in Noida days after he was recording video of himself posing as Superman by tying a cloth as cape around his neck. The boy, Surjeet, was standing atop a wooden box barely two feet in height. While trying to jump from the box, his cape got entangled, tightening the noose around his neck and he collapsed.

47.title: Policeman, his friend held over gang-rape of 17-year-old girl in UP
47.article_body: A 24-year-old police constable and his friend were arrested in connection with the alleged gang-rape of a 17-year-old girl, Uttar Pradesh's Aligarh Police said. The incident came to light after videos of the alleged sexual assault shot by the accused went viral, police added. The constable called her to a place after promising to marry her, the victim's mother claimed.

48.title: Hurriyat Conference calls for Kashmir bandh on May 21
48.article_body: The Hurriyat Conference on Wednesday called for Kashmir bandh on May 21 to pay tributes to Maulvi Mohammad Farooq Shah and Abdul Ghani Lone on their death anniversary. The separatist outfit asked people to visit Eidgah and offer prayers to the leaders. The group further condemned the continued detention of its members since August 2019 when Article 370 was abrogated.

49.title: Activists urge govt to make report on Hyderabad's Mecca Masjid blast public
49.article_body: Around 46 activists have urged the Telangana government to make public the Justice Bhaskar Rao Commission's report on the police firing at the mob during the 2007 Mecca Masjid bomb blast incident in Hyderabad. Notably, five civilians were killed during the police firing. The activists have also demanded government intervention in ensuring justice for the bereaved families.

50.title: Thought I'd get many offers post 'Lipstick...', but it didn't happen: Plabita
50.article_body: Speaking about her journey in the industry, actress Plabita Borthakur said, "There have been times when I was doing well...I'd do...two ads and my month would be sorted. And then 'Lipstick Under My Burkha' happened." "But...[the film] didn't release for three years...and then [when it] released, I thought I'd be surrounded by offers but that [didn't] happen," she added.

51.title: Russia to legalise crypto as means of payment 'sooner or later'
51.article_body: Russia's Industry and Trade Minister Denis Manturov has said the country will be legalising cryptocurrency as a means of payment "sooner or later". "The question is, when this happens, how it will be regulated, now that the central bank and government are actively working on it," he added. Russia has plans to issue its own digital rouble.

52.title: Losing any valuable party member diminishes us: Tharoor on Hardik’s exit
52.article_body: Reacting to Hardik Patel’s exit from Congress, party leader Shashi Tharoor said that it’s a loss for Congress. "Losing any valuable party member diminishes us," Tharoor added. "I am very disappointed…because I've met him and been impressed by the young man as somebody who has a lot of passion, intelligence and the ability to make very effective contributions," Tharoor stated.

53.title: Doctors at Delhi's Lady Hardinge stop work over assault incident
53.article_body: Resident doctors of Delhi's Lady Hardinge Medical College announced withdrawal from all services, including emergency, from 9 am on Thursday after a patient's relative assaulted some doctors. In a letter to the hospital administration, they said some resident doctors, including one female doctor, were intimidated and assaulted on May 18. They demanded an FIR and arrest of culprits immediately.

54.title: Price of domestic LPG cylinder crosses ₹1,000-mark as rate goes up by ₹3.50
54.article_body: The price of a 14.2-kg domestic LPG cylinder was hiked by ₹3.50 on Thursday, in the second such move this month. With this, the cost of a cylinder now crosses the ₹1,000-mark, according to ANI. With the price rise, a domestic LPG cylinder will cost ₹1,003 in Delhi and Mumbai, ₹1,029 in Kolkata, and ₹1,018.5 in Chennai from today.

55.title: Sensex tanks 1,000 points, Nifty dips below 16,000-mark
55.article_body: Domestic equity market benchmarks Sensex and Nifty tumbled nearly 2% in early trade on Thursday. Sensex tanked over 1,000 points, giving up 54,000 level, while Nifty plunged over 300 points, giving up 16,000. Barring ITC, all Sensex shares opened in the red today. Meanwhile, the Indian rupee opened 11 paise lower at 77.69 against the US dollar.

56.title: India reports 2,364 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 15,419
56.article_body: India has reported 2,364 COVID-19 cases, 2,582 recoveries and 10 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 1,829 COVID-19 cases and 33 deaths. Active cases in India stand at 15,419, while the death toll has risen to 5,24,303.

57.title: ED books Raj Kundra for money laundering in porn videos case
57.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) has registered a money laundering case against actress Shilpa Shetty's husband and businessman Raj Kundra in connection with the production and circulation of pornography films. Kundra was arrested by Mumbai Police in 2021 for allegedly running a porn racket with operations outside India as well. ED will probe into the financial transaction pertaining to the case.

58.title: Lot depends on how it unfolds in few months: Tharoor on 'Chintan Shivir'
58.article_body: Speaking about Congress’ 'Chintan Shivir', party leader Shashi Tharoor said it’s the beginning of an important process but a lot depends on how it unfolds over the next few months. "I think if people within the party feel there is a change, we'll also be able to see it in a renewed burst of energy in the party," Tharoor added.

59.title: 25-year-old man poses as cable operator, robs houses in Pune; held
59.article_body: A 25-year-old man was arrested for posing as personnel of an internet or cable service provider and robbing residential societies in Pune. The suspect, who is from Aurangabad, used to travel to Pune just for the robberies and targeted flats after thoroughly conducting a recce of the area, police said. Several stolen laptops and gold ornaments were recovered from him.

60.title: We keep naughty women at home: Taliban on women afraid to leave homes under its rule
60.article_body: When asked about women who say they are afraid to go out of their homes under Taliban rule, Afghanistan's acting interior minister and Taliban's co-deputy leader Sirajuddin Haqqani said, "We keep naughty women at home." "It was a joke referring to those naughty women who are controlled by some other sides to bring the current government into question," he added.

61.title: Action to be taken if unnecessary loudspeakers are installed: UP CM
61.article_body: UP CM Yogi Adityanath said action will be taken against the officials if complaints are received of "unnecessary" loudspeakers being installed and played loudly anywhere in the state. "The noise of loudspeakers should be within the premises where they are installed. We have set this example with amity. In the future also, such a situation should prevail," CM Yogi added.

62.title: Villagers in Himachal's Spiti oppose survey for gypsum mining
62.article_body: Villagers of Gue, located in Himachal Pradesh's Lahaul and Spiti, opposed survey of gypsum in the area fearing that government will lease out the sites to private companies. Gypsum is a mineral used in manufacturing fertilisers and cement, besides cosmetic products. As per the villagers, mining will have an adverse impact on the ecology as well as their culture.

63.title: Class 12 student attacked outside school in Delhi's Sultanpuri
63.article_body: A class 12 student of a government school was attacked with belts and knives outside his school in outer Delhi's Sultanpuri on Wednesday afternoon. The victim was walking out of the school after his examination when three-four boys attacked him, police said. The victim suffered a deep cut over his head and a stab wound on his thigh, police added.

64.title: Delhi govt likely to flag off 100 electric buses next week: Report
64.article_body: The Delhi government will likely flag off nearly 100 electric buses next week, media reports cited officials as saying. The government has received a batch of over 100 electric buses. While the ones planned to be flagged off next week are fully integrated, the remaining buses are still being integrated. There are two e-bus depots to house these buses.

65.title: Over 300 buses stay off-road in Mumbai as BEST staff go on strike
65.article_body: Over 300 mini buses remained off roads in Mumbai on Wednesday as the Brihanmumbai Electric Supply and Transport (BEST) staff went on a flash strike for the second consecutive day. The strike was called by the BEST staff over non-payment of salaries and provident fund. The bus operations at Bandra, Vikhroli and Kurla depots were badly affected, BEST officials said.

66.title: Wheat shouldn't go the way of COVID-19 vaccines: India calls out West on exports at UN
66.article_body: Calling out the West, India said that wheat should not go the way of the COVID-19 vaccines as it voiced concern over hoarding and discrimination amid the "unjustified increase" in food prices at the UN. "It is necessary for all of us to adequately appreciate the importance of equity, affordability and accessibility when it comes to food grains," India said.

67.title: US reports its 1st case of monkeypox this year
67.article_body: The US on Wednesday confirmed a case of monkeypox in a man who had recently travelled to Canada. It is the first monkeypox case reported in the country this year. "The case poses no risk to the public, and the individual is hospitalised and in good condition," the Massachusetts Department of Health said in a statement.

68.title: 3 killed as truck runs over sleeping migrant labourers in Haryana's Jhajjar
68.article_body: At least three migrant labourers died and 11 others were severely injured after a truck ran over them on Kundli-Manesar-Palwal Expressway in Haryana's Jhajjar district on Thursday morning. The migrant labourers were sleeping by the roadside near a toll plaza when the truck lost control and ran over them. Ten of the injured have been taken to Rohtak's PGIMS.

69.title: Kashmiri Pandits will not be posted in vulnerable areas: Official
69.article_body: Kashmir Divisional Commissioner Pandurang K Pole on Wednesday said he has directed all heads of the government departments to ensure that Kashmiri Pandit employees are not posted in vulnerable areas. He said they should be assigned duties in towns or district headquarters. This comes days after Rahul Bhat, an employee belonging to the community, was killed in Budgam.

70.title: Death toll due to Assam floods rises to 9, over 6 lakh affected in 27 districts
70.article_body: At least nine people have lost their lives so far due to the floods in Assam, the state Disaster Management Authority said. More than 6.62 lakh people in 27 districts of Assam have been affected by the floods and landslides, it added. Around 48,000 people have taken shelter in 135 relief camps in different districts of the state.

71.title: None of the star kids I've worked with made me feel like an outsider: Tara
71.article_body: When asked how she feels working with star kids, actress Tara Sutaria said, "Most of my films are with star kids from earlier generation actors only. It's not right to keep tagging them as star kids." "I feel doing so is really very unfair. None of these actors I've worked with ever made me feel like an outsider," she added.

72.title: Inter-state drug cartel busted in Delhi, heroin worth ₹20 cr seized
72.article_body: Delhi Police's Special Cell recently busted an inter-state drug cartel by arresting an active member of the syndicate. Acting on a tip-off, the accused, identified as Rajesh Gupta, was arrested from Deen Dayal Upadhyay Marg when he was on his way to supply the consignment to different parts of Delhi. Police also seized heroin worth ₹20 crore from him.

73.title: Gautam Gambhir's angry celebration after LSG's 2-run win over KKR goes viral
73.article_body: LSG mentor Gautam Gambhir's angry celebration after his team's two-run victory against KKR has gone viral. Gambhir was seen banging the table after Rinku Singh's wicket on the second-last ball of the last over. After LSG clinched the win by dismissing Umesh Yadav on the last ball, Gambhir was seen screaming and hugging his colleagues in an animated manner.

74.title: We have no money to buy petrol, do not wait in queues at pumps: Sri Lanka to citizens
74.article_body: Sri Lanka currently has no money to pay for petrol shipments, Power and Energy Minister Kanchana Wijesekera told parliament as he appealed to people to stop queuing at fuel pumps. A petrol shipment has been at Colombo port since March 28 but the government has been unable to pay, he added. "We are working to find funds," he further said.

75.title: Tesla cut from S&P 500 ESG Index, Musk says 'ESG is a scam'
75.article_body: The S&P 500 removed Tesla from its ESG Index as part of an annual update citing issues including claims of racial discrimination and poor working conditions at Tesla. Responding to the exclusion, Tesla CEO Elon Musk said, "ESG is a scam. It has been weaponised by phoney social justice warriors." "S&P Global Ratings has lost their integrity," he added.

76.title: Class 12 student stabs girlfriend's classmate for talking to her near Hyd
76.article_body: A class 12 student allegedly stabbed his girlfriend's classmate for talking to her near Hyderabad in Ranga Reddy's Rajendranagar Mandal in Telangana, police said. "After the accused came to know that his girlfriend is talking to her classmate, he called the victim...stabbed him," police added. The victim and the girl were classmates, Banjara Hills Inspector Nageshwar Rao said.

77.title: I can no longer support Democrats, will vote Republican: Elon Musk
77.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has said that while he voted for Democrats in the past, he will now vote for Republicans. "In the past I voted Democrat, because they were (mostly) the kindness party. But they have become the party of division & hate, so I can no longer support them and will vote Republican," he tweeted.

78.title: Bengaluru reports 112 of Karnataka's 122 new COVID-19 cases
78.article_body: Karnataka on Wednesday registered 122 new COVID-19 cases and of these, 112 cases were reported from Bengaluru alone. The city also reported 150 recoveries and one coronavirus-related death during the same period. The number of active cases in Bengaluru now stands at 1,684 with a positivity rate of 0.93%, according to data published by Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP).

79.title: Headmistress arrested for carrying beef to school in Assam
79.article_body: A government school headmistress was booked and arrested for allegedly carrying beef to school for lunch in Assam's Goalpara district. "The school management committee said that she had brought beef to school for lunch and was serving it to some members of the staff, which created a sense of discomfort among them," said a police officer.

80.title: Elon Musk loses $12 billion in a day after he tweets on politics, criticises ESG
80.article_body: Elon Musk lost $12 billion in a day after he took to Twitter to announce his political switch from Democrat to Republican and criticised Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG). Musk remains the world's richest person, with a fortune of around $210 billion, according to the Bloomberg Billionaires Index. Musk called Democrats the party of division and hate.

81.title: 52-year-old motor workshop owner shot dead in Delhi's Daryaganj
81.article_body: A 52-year-old motor workshop owner was shot dead in Delhi's Daryaganj by bike-borne assailants on Tuesday night, police said. "The injured had received two gunshots and was rushed to Lok Nayak Hospital where he was declared dead," police added. The victim had gone to urinate before closing the shop and was coming back when the assailants shot him.

82.title: Hyderabad airport wins green award for 5th consecutive year
82.article_body: The Rajiv Gandhi International Airport in Hyderabad has won a silver award for efficient carbon management in the Airports Council International's Green Airports Recognition programme. This is for the fifth consecutive time that the airport has won the award. It was announced in the 15-50 million passengers per annum category in the Asia-Pacific region.

83.title: Thane woman abandons her baby, says 'wanted to start afresh'
83.article_body: A Thane-based woman was arrested for abandoning her 15-day-old baby near a dustbin at Mumbai's Marine Drive, police said. During interrogation, the woman said she was forcefully married to a man twice her age and had run away from his house. She allegedly dumped the baby as she "wanted to start afresh and settle down with someone of her age".

84.title: LSG eliminate KKR from IPL 2022 playoffs race with 2-run win, become 2nd team to advance
84.article_body: LSG defeated KKR by two runs in their final league match of IPL 2022 to become the second team after GT to qualify for the playoffs. With the defeat, KKR have been eliminated from the playoffs race. LSG put up a total of 210/0, with Quinton De Kock scoring 140*(70). KKR were restricted to 208/8 in their 20 overs.

85.title: EU chief proposes up to €9 billion in more aid to Ukraine
85.article_body: European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen on Wednesday proposed extra aid to Ukraine of up to €9 billion to help the country amid the ongoing Russian invasion. The money would be offered to Ukraine in the form of loans, according to a report. It's time to think about rebuilding Ukraine whenever the war ends, the EU chief said.

86.title: Mahesh Babu trolled over pan masala brand's ad after saying 'Bollywood can't afford me'
86.article_body: Telugu actor Mahesh Babu has been trolled for featuring in a pan masala brand's advertisement from last year alongside Tiger Shroff. This comes after his comments wherein he said "Bollywood can't afford me". "It's funny how #MaheshBabu said that #Bollywood can't afford him. But a pan masala brand can," a person tweeted while another Twitter user called it "double standards".

87.title: Plaque of Aurangzeb must be removed from all areas: Agra Mayor
87.article_body: Agra Mayor Naveen Jain said if there is a plaque of Mughal emperor Aurangzeb or if a road is named after him, it must be removed. "Aurangzeb was a cruel ruler who destroyed Hindu temples and compelled people of the Hindu community to convert to Islam," he said. His comment came after controversy over Akbaruddin Owaisi's visit to Aurangzeb's tomb.

88.title: Greece to end mandatory face mask-wearing in planes & indoor areas
88.article_body: Greece's Health Minister Thanos Plevris on Wednesday said that the country would end the mandatory wearing of face masks in airplanes and indoor public venues from June 1. Plevris, however, added that wearing of masks will remain mandatory in hospitals, nursing homes and urban transport like buses and metro. Greece reported more than 4,000 cases of coronavirus on Wednesday.

89.title: MVA govt has 'murdered' OBC's political reservation: Fadnavis
89.article_body: BJP leader Devendra Fadnavis criticised the Maha Vikas Aghadi government, saying it has "murdered" the OBC's political reservation in local body polls in Maharashtra. "If Maharashtra had done the 'Triple Test', then the reservation of OBC would have been applicable here too," Fadnavis said. This comes after Supreme Court allowed OBC reservation for local body elections in Madhya Pradesh.

90.title: Politics of dishonesty, betrayal: Cong leader on Hardik's exit
90.article_body: Gujarat AICC in-charge Raghu Sharma criticised Hardik Patel over his resignation from the Congress, calling it "politics of dishonesty, betrayal". Alleging that Patel was in touch with the BJP for the last six months, he said, "He was bad-mouthing BJP in UP, Uttarakhand and Punjab. What happened overnight?" Sharma also claimed that Patel's resignation letter was not drafted by him.

91.title: Minister Ajay Mishra's nephew dies as tree branch falls on him in Lakhimpur
91.article_body: Union Minister Ajay Mishra's 41-year-old nephew Achin Mishra alias Sonu died after a branch of a tree fell on him while he was riding a motorcycle in Uttar Pradesh's Lakhimpur Kheri on Wednesday, police said. Some people took him to a hospital, where he was declared dead. The deceased is the son of Ajay Mishra's elder brother.

92.title: Mahesh's 'B'wood can't afford me' remark was innocent statement: Ameesha
92.article_body: Actress Ameesha Patel has reacted to Mahesh Babu's 'Bollywood can't afford me' statement and called it an "innocent statement". "I don't think he meant any harm and it should not be blown out of proportion," she added. "He is very dignified and a lovely person. Mahesh Babu can do no wrong," she concluded. Ameesha and Mahesh had featured in 'Naani'.

93.title: KCR felicitates 110-yr-old environmentalist Saalumarada Thimmakka
93.article_body: A 110-year-old environmentalist, Saalumarada Thimmakka, was felicitated by Telangana Chief Minister K Chandrashekar Rao in Hyderabad, when Thimmakka paid a courtesy visit to him at Pragati Bhavan. "Chief Minister Rao is working very hard for the development of Telangana," Thimmakka said. She also expressed happiness over development in the spheres of agriculture and forestry in Telangana.

94.title: Target's shares crash 26%, on track for their worst day since 1987
94.article_body: The shares of American department store chain Target crashed 26% on Wednesday and were on track to log their worst day since the 1987's 'Black Monday' stock market crash. Target's shares slumped after it reported a 52% drop in profit for Q1 2022. Target also warned of a bigger margin hit this year due to rising fuel and freight costs.

95.title: This is a man who tried to kill me, he's also my husband: Amber on Depp
95.article_body: Amber Heard, while being cross-examined by Johnny Depp's lawyer, was asked if she was scared of him. To this, Amber replied, "This is a man who tried to kill me...it's scary. He's also my husband." While being questioned about the couple's fight in Australia in March 2015, Amber denied assaulting Depp in the country, adding, "I didn't assault Johnny ever."

96.title: World's oldest living man confirmed as 112-year-old from Venezuela, pics released
96.article_body: Juan Vicente Pérez, from Venezuela, has been officially confirmed as the oldest person living (male) at 112 years and 253 days, as of February 4, 2022. He has 11 children, 41 grandchildren, 18 great-grandchildren and 12 great-great-grandchildren. Juan is just days away from his 113th birthday, revealed a post by Guinness World Records.

97.title: Man pleads guilty to killing 5 people in Norway bow-and-arrow attacks
97.article_body: A man on Wednesday pleaded guilty to stabbing five people to death and attempting to kill 11 others with bow and arrow in Norway's Kongsberg in October last year. The 38-year-old attacker, Espen Andersen Braathen, suffered from mental illness at time of attacks and should be sentenced to psychiatric care, prosecutors said. Proceedings in the trial will continue till June.

98.title: Wasn't reacting as producer: Sarah on Chris' alleged sexual misconduct
98.article_body: 'Sex and the City' actress Sarah Jessica Parker revealed she hasn't spoken to co-star Chris Noth since his sexual assault allegations. Asking about her reaction as a producer, she said, "Don't...know if I'm ready to talk about it, but...I wasn't reacting as a producer." "We're deeply saddened to hear the allegations," Sarah and her co-stars had said in a statement.

99.title: Tencent's profit halves in Q1 2022, its worst performance since 2004
99.article_body: China's Tencent said its profit had halved YoY and it recorded no revenue growth in Q1 2022, its worst performance since 2004. Tencent's revenue in Q1 2022 was ¥135.5 billion (₹1,55,959 crore) as compared with ¥135.3 billion (₹1,55,728 crore) in Q1 2021. This comes after China launched a regulatory crackdown last year to reign in influence of large internet firms.

100.title: AAP's CM face in U'khand Assembly polls Ajay Kothiyal quits party
100.article_body: Colonel Ajay Kothiyal (Retired), AAP's CM face in the Uttarakhand Assembly elections that were held in February this year, resigned from the party on Wednesday. He had contested polls from the Gangotri Assembly constituency and joined AAP on April 19 last year. Kothiyal, who shared his resignation letter on Twitter, did not provide any reason for quitting the party.

101.title: Surat Police seize 30 kg of marijuana worth ₹3 lakh, 3 arrested
101.article_body: The Surat Police said that they arrested three youths from Odisha and seized marijuana worth ₹3 lakh from them. The Special Operation Group (SOG) intercepted three youths whose movements were suspicious and upon checking, over 30.35 kg marijuana was found in their luggage. Police said they are trying to find out who they were supposed to deliver the contraband to.

102.title: Head constable arrested for taking bribe of ₹20,000 in MP's Bhind
102.article_body: A head constable posted in Malanpur of Madhya Pradesh's Bhind district was arrested by the Lokayukta police for accepting a bribe of ₹20,000. The head constable, identified as Manish Pachauri, reportedly demanded the bribe from the victim and threatened to implicate him in a false case. After the incident, the victim approached the Lokayukta police and complained.

103.title: Lucknow University prof assaulted after remark on Kashi Vishwanath temple
103.article_body: Lucknow University's Associate Professor RV Chandan was allegedly assaulted by a student on the campus on Wednesday, days after he made "objectionable" comments on Varanasi's Kashi Vishwanath temple. "Karthik Pandey, a student leader, came to me, started hurling abuses and casteist slurs at me and hit me," Chandan said. Pandey was overpowered by guards and handed over to the police.

104.title: ABVP holds protest over SSC recruitment scam in Kolkata
104.article_body: Members of the Akhil Bharatiya Vidyarthi Parishad (ABVP) held a protest in Kolkata against the alleged irregularities in the SSC recruitment process and the deteriorating law and order situation in the state. The police used water cannons and barricades to stop the protesters. ABVP further demanded transparency with regards to the SSC recruitment process.

105.title: LSG record the highest opening partnership in IPL history
105.article_body: Lucknow Super Giants (LSG) on Wednesday recorded the highest-ever opening partnership in IPL history. Quinton De Kock and KL Rahul shared an unbeaten 210-run stand against KKR to set the record. The previous record was held by Jonny Bairstow and David Warner, who shared a 185-run opening stand for SRH against RCB on March 31, 2019.

106.title: Telangana's 'Tree Man' injured in accident on way to water plants
106.article_body: The 'Tree Man' of Telangana, Daripalli Ramaiah, received injuries to his right leg and head after falling on road from his bicycle on his way to water plants on Wednesday. The 85-year-old Padma Shri awardee is in ICU and his condition is stable, doctors said. He is said to have planted over one crore trees.

107.title: ₹4 lakh ex-gratia for families of Morbi wall collapse victims: CM
107.article_body: Gujarat Chief Minister Bhupendra Patel announced a compensation of ₹4 lakh to the families of the 12 people who died after a wall of a salt factory collapsed in Gujarat's Morbi. "My condolences to the bereaved families," Patel tweeted. Prime Minister Narendra Modi also expressed grief at the loss of lives in the mishap and called the tragedy "heart-rending".

108.title: Cannes-like festival should happen in India: Filmmaker Shekhar Kapur
108.article_body: Filmmaker Shekhar Kapur said a Cannes-like film festival should be held in India. "The next Cannes is in India because if it's not, then I don't know where Cannes will go. We're the land of stories. The west is plateauing...the east is rising. We're the east, we've to step forward," he stated. "This is a moment of confidence," he added.

109.title: Ukraine's Prez gets standing ovation after his speech at Cannes
109.article_body: Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Tuesday received a standing ovation after he virtually addressed the opening ceremony of the Cannes Film Festival. In his address, Zelenskyy quoted Charlie Chaplin's film 'The Great Dictator', saying, "[Hate] of men will pass and dictators die and...power they took from...people will return to...people." His remarks came amid Russia's invasion of Ukraine.

110.title: Finland & Sweden to buy weapons together as they apply to join NATO
110.article_body: Finland and Sweden will procure portable firearms and anti-tank weapons together, Finland's defence ministry said on Wednesday. The purchase will include assault rifles, shotguns, missiles, recoilless rifles and arms for personal protection, the ministry added. The announcement comes as both countries handed over their applications to NATO to join the military alliance earlier today.

111.title: 28% GST on casinos, online gaming in final report by Group of Ministers: Report
111.article_body: The Group of Ministers tasked to review the GST levy on casinos, racecourses and online gaming finalised its report that reportedly favours 28% tax on the three services. The final report by the panel led by Meghalaya CM Conrad Sangma will be handed over to Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman in a day or two. Currently, these services attract 18% GST.

112.title: Quinton De Kock smashes 10 sixes in an innings, records highest score of IPL 2022
112.article_body: Lucknow Super Giants (LSG) opener Quinton De Kock on Wednesday recorded the highest individual score of IPL 2022 by scoring 140*(70) against Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR). De Kock smashed 10 sixes and 10 fours in his innings. It is also the third-highest individual score in IPL history after Chris Gayle's 175* and Brendon McCullum's 158*.

113.title: Not aware if Shailesh Lodha wants to quit 'Taarak Mehta...': Producer
113.article_body: Producer Asit Modi, in an interview, said that he is not aware that Shailesh Lodha wants to quit 'Taarak Mehta Ka Ooltah Chashmah'. "I've not been informed...If there is any development, I'll surely speak about it," he said. This comes after reports had stated that Shailesh, who plays Taarak, was unhappy with his contract and will be quitting the show.

114.title: List of cities with highest maximum temperature today released
114.article_body: The IMD has released the name of cities that reported more than 43°C on Wednesday. UP's Banda with 46.2°C had the highest maximum temperature, followed by Jhansi's 45.4°C. UP's Prayagraj and Rajasthan's Pilani recorded 45.2°C as maximum temperature and Rajasthan's Churu and MP's Nowgong had 45°C as maximum temperature. Eleven cities recorded maximum temperature between 44°C and 45°C.

115.title: Former soldier, who lost both legs in Afghanistan, climbs 3,560-ft mountain in UK
115.article_body: A former soldier, who lost both his legs while fighting in Afghanistan in 2011, has climbed the highest mountain in Wales. Double amputee Liam King scaled Mount Snowdon, which is 3,560-feet-tall. He made it to the summit in seven hours with fellow veteran Luke Read. "I wanted to prove to myself that I can do it," said Liam.

116.title: Video shows Anil Kapoor dancing in Rajasthan while Jeremy Renner claps
116.article_body: A video of Anil Kapoor dancing in front of schoolchildren in Alwar, Rajasthan has gone viral on social media. 'Avengers' actor Jeremy Renner can be seen clapping to Anil's dance in the video. This comes after pictures of Anil and Jeremy shooting in Rajasthan began circulating on social media. Anil is shooting with Jeremy for series 'Rennervations'.

117.title: Bike taxi driver arrested for following, eve-teasing 24-yr-old woman racer in TN
117.article_body: Police has arrested a 34-year-old bike taxi driver in Chennai for allegedly following and eve-teasing 24-year-old professional motorcycle racer and two-time national champion Nivetha Jessica. She said that Hasan had followed her on his bike for around 10 minutes on May 11. Nivetha added that when she yelled at him, he rode away, shouting, "I will do this again."

118.title: Tribal students protest, demand more colleges in MP's Jabalpur
118.article_body: Tribal students of Bargi constituency of Madhya Pradesh's Jabalpur district staged a protest, demanding colleges to be built in Bargi and Chargwan. The students along with Congress MLA Sanjay Yadav reached the commissioner's office and submitted a written memorandum regarding the issue. Many students discontinued their studies after class 12 due to lack of colleges, a student said.

119.title: Russia expels 85 diplomats from European nations in tit-for-tat move
119.article_body: Russian Foreign Ministry on Wednesday announced the expulsion of 85 embassy staff from France, Spain and Italy in response to similar moves by these countries. These three countries are among European nations that have reportedly expelled over 200 Russian diplomats since the country began invading Ukraine in February. Meanwhile, Italian PM Mario Draghi called Russia's announcement a "hostile act".

120.title: Google's Russian subsidiary to file for bankruptcy after account seizure
120.article_body: Google's Russian subsidiary plans to file for bankruptcy after its bank account was seized by authorities, a Google spokesperson said on Wednesday. "Russian authorities' seizure of Google Russia's bank account has made it untenable for our Russia office to function," the spokesperson said. This is the first time that Google said its bank account as a whole has been seized.

121.title: India's richest man enters the healthcare sector with 'Adani Health Ventures'
121.article_body: India's richest man Gautam Adani has entered the healthcare sector with Adani Enterprises' wholly-owned subsidiary 'Adani Health Ventures Limited' (AHVL). "The subsidiary was incorporated on May 17, 2022, to carry on the business of healthcare-related activities," a filing said. The activities include medical and diagnostic facilities, health aids and health tech-based facilities among others.

122.title: 3 Delhi civic bodies unified, to be treated as one from May 22
122.article_body: The Ministry of Home Affairs on Wednesday issued a notification for the unification of the three civic bodies of Delhi. The South, North and East civic bodies will be treated as one Municipal Corporation of Delhi from May 22. Legislation to unify the civic bodies was approved by Lok Sabha on March 30 and by Rajya Sabha on April 5.

123.title: People queue up in Colombo to get 2-time meals amid economic crisis
123.article_body: Several Sri Lankan citizens, including daily wage labourers, have queued up at Galle Face in Colombo to receive two-time meals from a food trust. "[People] are coming from far away by buses, taxis and train(s)...We provide food to all without...discrimination," a social worker said. Sri Lanka is reeling under economic crisis which has triggered a shortage of essentials, including food.

124.title: 21-year-old Russian soldier pleads guilty to killing 62-year-old civilian in Ukraine
124.article_body: A Russian soldier accused of war crimes in Ukraine pleaded guilty on Wednesday to killing a 62-year-old unarmed civilian. Vadim Shishimarin, a 21-year-old Russian tank commander, entered his plea in a Kyiv district court hearing its first war crimes trial since Moscow's invasion of Ukraine. If convicted, he faces up to life imprisonment.

125.title: AIMIM leader held over derogatory post on 'Shivling' inside Gyanvapi Mosque
125.article_body: Gujarat AIMIM leader Danish Qureshi was arrested by the Ahmedabad Police on Wednesday for making derogatory remarks on Twitter on the 'Shivling' found inside the Gyanvapi Mosque complex. Qureshi was arrested after Hindu organisations made a representation before the police. "We carried out a technical analysis of the Twitter handle and arrested Qureshi," said ACP (Crime Branch) JM Yadav.

126.title: Can we call ourselves democracy: DK Shivakumar on Panchayat polls
126.article_body: KPCC president DK Shivakumar held the Karnataka government responsible for the "non-conduct of Panchayat elections". He also expressed concerns regarding Karnataka State Election Commission's urgent petition in the High Court. "When the Election Commission itself says the government has taken away its powers, can we call ourselves a democracy?" he questioned.

127.title: Mumbai Naval officer asked to fill KYC details, cheated of ₹1 lakh
127.article_body: The Mumbai police have registered a case against an unidentified person after a senior Naval officer was cheated of ₹1 lakh. The complaint said the officer received a text message with a link asking him to complete his KYC formalities. As the officer entered his bank details, the accused transferred ₹1 lakh to his own account, a police officer said.

128.title: 13-year-old girl raped by relative in Pune, case registered
128.article_body: A 13-year-old girl was allegedly raped by her relative in Pune's Lonikand. Reports say that the accused, a distant relative of the victim, ran away from the scene after he committed the crime. The accused raped the minor when she was alone at home, reports stated. The police have registered a case under relevant sections of IPC and POCSO Act.

129.title: Cleanliness drive launched around Navi Mumbai's Ballaleshwar Lake
129.article_body: In a joint effort by NGO Robin Hood Army and the Rotaract club of Panvel Industrial Town, a cleanliness drive was launched around Ballaleshwar Lake, which is Panvel's oldest lake. Volunteers said that the waste mostly constituted of single-use plastic. The aim is to encourage people to reduce, reuse and recycle non-biodegradable substances, a volunteer said.

130.title: Don't line up for petrol, we can't buy it: Sri Lankan govt to citizens
130.article_body: Sri Lankan government on Wednesday urged citizens to not line up to buy petrol as the country doesn't have foreign exchange to pay for it. Energy Minister Kanchana Wijesekera told parliament that payment for a previous shipment of petrol worth $53 million is also pending. Earlier, Sri Lankan PM had said that the country was left with limited petrol stocks.

131.title: Jury shown knife actress Amber Heard gave actor Johnny Depp in 2012
131.article_body: The jury was shown a knife which was gifted by actress Amber Heard to actor Johnny Depp in 2012. Amber had alleged that Depp began abusing her in 2011 before a break in 2012. Depp's lawyer asked Amber, "That's the knife...you gave to the man who was abusing you?" To this, Amber replied, "I wasn't afraid of him stabbing me."

132.title: Rahul preferred choice of party workers to be Cong chief: Tharoor
132.article_body: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor has said that there remains no doubt that his party colleague Rahul Gandhi would be the preferred choice of an overwhelming majority of party workers to be Congress chief. However, he added that Rahul has not indicated whether he wants the job. His comments come days after the Congress organised a three-day 'Chintan Shivir' in Rajasthan.

133.title: Pak woman lost during Partition meets Indian brothers after 75 yrs at Kartarpur
133.article_body: A woman who was separated from her family during Partition met her brothers from India at Kartarpur in Pakistan's Punjab province after 75 years. Mumtaz Bibi was born in a Sikh family and was raised by a Muslim couple in Pakistan. She got to know about her real family two years ago and got connected with them through social media.

134.title: Rajasthan Congress MLA Ganesh Ghogra resigns from his seat, says 'was being ignored'
134.article_body: Congress MLA from Rajasthan's Dungarpur, Ganesh Ghogra, resigned from his seat on Wednesday. He is also the president of the state Youth Congress. Ghogra said he was being ignored despite being an MLA of the ruling party in the state. He added that the administration doesn't listen when he brings up people's concerns.

135.title: Bengaluru-based Grammy winner Ricky Kej repeats his Grammy outfit at Cannes
135.article_body: US-born Indian music composer Ricky Kej, who has lived in Bengaluru since he was eight, repeated his Grammy Awards outfit at the Cannes Film Festival. Two-time Grammy award-winner, Kej, took to Instagram to share his pictures from both the events and wrote, "Fashion can be trendy twice." Citing pollution from the fashion industry, he added, "Fast fashion isn't always fashionable."

136.title: ITC reports 11.7% YoY rise in net profit to ₹4,196 crore in Q4
136.article_body: FMCG giant ITC Limited on Wednesday reported an 11.7% YoY rise in consolidated net profit at ₹4,196 crore in Q4 FY22, against ₹3,755 crore reported in Q4 FY21. Consolidated revenue for Q4 FY22 came in at ₹17,754 crore, a 15.3% YoY rise from ₹15,404 crore. ITC's consolidated PAT and revenue for FY22 jumped to ₹15,243 crore and ₹65,205 crore respectively.

137.title: Landmines explode along LoC due to forest fire in J&K
137.article_body: A forest fire has triggered several landmine explosions along the LoC in Jammu and Kashmir's Poonch district, officials said on Wednesday. The landmines were part of the anti-infiltration obstacle system. "The forest fire has been raging for the past three days...This morning it started in Daramshal block and spread fast due to powerful winds," Forester Kanar Hussain Shah said.

138.title: Heroism is working again: Bhushan Kumar on success of South films
138.article_body: T-Series head Bhushan Kumar, speaking about the recent success of South films, said, "They're pure entertainers. They have music, action, heroism, the mother element, the way it used to be in our 90s films." "They are presenting it at a high scale...it's working," he stated while adding that people won't watch scaled-down mass entertainers. "Heroism is working again," he concluded.

139.title: Ukraine 'lacks will' to continue peace talks: Russia
139.article_body: Russia has accused Ukraine of not wanting to continue talks to end hostilities amid the ongoing conflict between the two nations. "Talks are indeed not moving forward and we note...complete lack of will of Ukrainian negotiators to continue this process," Kremlin spokesman Dmitry Peskov said. This comes after Kyiv's negotiator Mykhailo Podolyak said that talks with Moscow were "on hold".

140.title: TN CM hails Rajiv Gandhi assassination convict's release from jail
140.article_body: Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin reacted to release of Perarivalan, one of the convicts in ex-PM Rajiv Gandhi's assassination case, praising verdict for serving as an example of India's federalism. "Congratulations...to Perarivalan for fully breathing...the air of liberation [after over] 30 years of [jail]," he tweeted. Stalin also praised Perarivalan's mother for her perseverance during his imprisonment.

141.title: Battery car services to Vaishno Devi shrine suspended for the day
141.article_body: The battery car services to the Vaishno Devi shrine were suspended on the new track on Wednesday due to a forest fire in the Trikuta hills. However, the pilgrimage continued through the traditional track. The fire broke out near the Sanji Chhat helipad in the forest area of Trikuta hills on late Sunday evening.

142.title: World's tallest building Burj Khalifa vanishes in a layer of dust amid sandstorm
142.article_body: The world's tallest building Burj Khalifa disappeared behind a grey layer of dust today as sandstorms that have swept the Middle East hit the United Arab Emirates, prompting weather and traffic warnings. Capital city Abu Dhabi's air quality index (AQI) soared into the "hazardous" zone overnight. Authorities issued a nationwide warning urging residents to remain vigilant.

143.title: Nikhat reaches final at Women's World Boxing Championships; Manisha, Parveen win bronze
143.article_body: Indian boxer Nikhat Zareen defeated Brazil's Caroline De Almeida to enter the 52-kg category final at the Women's World Boxing Championships. Meanwhile, Manisha Moun bagged a bronze medal after losing in the semi-final against Tokyo Olympics bronze medallist Irma Testa. In the 63-kg category, Parveen Hooda bagged a bronze after losing to European Championships bronze medallist Amy Broadhurst.

144.title: LSG to bat first against KKR in their last league stage match, make 3 changes
144.article_body: LSG captain KL Rahul won the toss and elected to bat first against KKR in their last league stage clash in IPL 2022 on Wednesday. LSG have made three changes to their playing XI, with Manan Vohra, Evin Lewis and Krishnappa Gowtham replacing Ayush Badoni, Dushmantha Chameera and Krunal Pandya. KKR have replaced Ajinkya Rahane with Abhijeet Tomar.

145.title: India looks a lot like Sri Lanka: Rahul on graphs comparing economies
145.article_body: Congress' Rahul Gandhi on Wednesday accused the Centre of failing to curb inflation and employment crisis in the country and stated that "India looks a lot like Sri Lanka". Gandhi took to Twitter to share graphs comparing both countries' statistics on unemployment, petrol prices and communal violence. Notably, Sri Lanka is undergoing its worst economic crisis since its independence.

146.title: It deeply saddens us: Congress on Rajiv Gandhi assassination convict's release
146.article_body: After the Supreme Court ordered release of AG Perarivalan, one of the convicts in Rajiv Gandhi's assassination case, Congress spokesperson Randeep Singh Surjewala said, "The decision...deeply saddens us." "If those guilty of terrorism and assassination of a PM are going to be released like this, then who'll uphold the majesty and the integrity of law in this country," he asked.

147.title: Punjab govt agrees to farmers' demand on advancing paddy sowing
147.article_body: The Punjab government on Wednesday accepted the demands raised by the Samyukt Kisan Morcha (SKM) by agreeing to advance the paddy transplantation in three phases beginning June 7. The earlier schedule of paddy transplantation consisted of four phases starting June 18. The government also agreed to buy moong (green grams) at MSP, for which the mandis have been identified.

148.title: I am leaving Twitter, it's not because of Elon: Twitter VP of Product Management
148.article_body: Ilya Brown, one of Twitter's latest three senior executives to leave Twitter, tweeted, "Yes, I'm leaving Twitter. No, it is not because of Elon or uncertainty inside the company." Ilya Brown, Twitter's Vice President of Product Management, said, "It has been an amazing six years and I've loved every second of it." Ilya added, "I will forever love this place."

149.title: Open to the idea of Chris Rock hosting Oscars 2023: ABC President
149.article_body: ABC President of Entertainment Craig Erwich has said that they are open to the idea of Chris Rock hosting the Academy Awards in 2023. This comes after actor Will Smith slapped Chris Rock during the 2022 event. "There was a...controversy, which overshadowed a lot of...positive things about the show, but I was really happy with the program," Craig said.

150.title: Pune's new art centre 'Zapurza' to be inaugurated on May 19
150.article_body: An all-inclusive art point named 'Zapurza' is set to be inaugurated in Pune on Thursday. The centre, which was reportedly under construction for four years, will house as many as eight galleries, an amphitheatre, an auditorium and will display various artworks from locations including Mumbai and Kolhapur. Additionally, there will be two separate galleries dedicated to jewellery and textiles.

151.title: Hyd Police arrests university VC in fake educational certificates scam
151.article_body: Hyderabad Police has arrested the vice-chancellor of Bhopal's Sarvepalli Radhakrishnan University in connection with a fake educational certificates scam. A former vice-chancellor has also been arrested. In February, four cases were registered against a few educational consultants and the management of the university for allegedly providing educational certificates in return for money.

152.title: Railway employee crushed to death by train in Gr Noida: Police
152.article_body: A 33-year-old railway employee died on duty after being run over by a train in Greater Noida on Wednesday morning, police said. The deceased, identified as Sunil Kumar Verma, was working on the rail track segment near Dadri when he got hit by the train, police added. Verma was reportedly working with the railway as technician grade one (signal).

153.title: I've to breathe: Rajiv Gandhi assassination convict on release from jail after 31 yrs
153.article_body: AG Perarivalan, one of the convicts in former PM Rajiv Gandhi's assassination case, was released from jail after 31 years on the order of the Supreme Court today. As he stepped out, Perarivalan told reporters, "I have just come out...I've to breathe a bit. Give me some time." He further said he firmly believes "there's no need for capital punishment".

154.title: ₹25,000 aid will be given for rain-hit houses in B'luru: K'taka CM
154.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai has announced that a compensation of ₹25,000 would be given each to those whose houses have been flooded and affected due to heavy rains in Bengaluru. Furthermore, Bommai also announced a compensation of ₹5 lakh each for the families of the two labourers who died due to heavy rainfall at a pipeline work site in Bengaluru.

155.title: I have the honour of having the most-liked tweet of any living human: Musk
155.article_body: Elon Musk said, "I have the honour of having the most-liked tweet of any living human. Thank you everyone for liking my tweet." Musk said that his tweet, "Next I'm buying Coca-Cola to put the cocaine back in," has over 4.8 million likes. Notably, the tweet announcing actor Chadwick Boseman's death is the most-liked ever, with over 7.1 million likes.

156.title: Protesting farmers to meet Punjab CM to discuss their demands
156.article_body: A group of protesting Punjab farmers on Wednesday said they'll meet CM Bhagwant Mann to discuss their demands. "[Deputy Commissioner] and SSP came to take us (for the meeting) and...message (for the meeting) is from CM sahab," said farmer leader Baldev Singh Sirsa. This comes after farmers protested near the Chandigarh-Mohali border on Tuesday after being stopped from entering Chandigarh.

157.title: Tata Consumer Products in talks to acquire as many as 5 brands
157.article_body: Tata Consumer Products (TCP), the food and beverage arm of Tata Group, is in talks to acquire as many as five consumer brands. A "significant amount" of the Mumbai-based firm's future growth will come from inorganic expansion, TCP CEO Sunil D'Souza said. "We're reaching out to potential targets to have a chat to see if there is interest," D'Souza added.

158.title: BJP creating communal issues to divert attention from price hike: Mamata
158.article_body: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee on Wednesday alleged, "The Narendra Modi government is engineering communal disturbances to divert the attention of the common people." She accused the Centre of looting the common people by hiking the prices of domestic gas, petrol and diesel. Banerjee was addressing a party programme at Midnapore College ground.

159.title: Delhi Lieutenant Governor Anil Baijal resigns: Reports
159.article_body: Delhi Lieutenant Governor Anil Baijal has submitted his resignation to President Ram Nath Kovind, citing personal reasons, according to reports. He was appointed as the Delhi Lieutenant Governor in December, 2016 after Najeeb Jung had resigned from the post. He had previously served as the Union Home Secretary.

160.title: Video shows white man urinating on black student's books, laptop in SA; students protest
160.article_body: Students have launched protests at South Africa's Stellenbosch University after a video showing a white student urinating on a black student's personal belongings, including books and laptop, surfaced online. The accused, who has been identified as 25-year-old Theuns Du Toit, has been suspended. "It's a White thing, boy," Du Toit reportedly told the student after urinating on his things.

161.title: 959 Ukrainian fighters in Mariupol surrendered so far: Russia
161.article_body: Russia's Defence Ministry said 694 Ukrainian fighters who'd been holed up in Mariupol's Azovstal steelworks, last bastion of Ukrainian resistance in the city, have surrendered over the past 24 hours. So far, 959 soldiers at the plant have handed themselves over to Russian troops, it added. Ukraine has offered to release Russian prisoners of war in exchange for Mariupol fighters.

162.title: K'taka HC quashes BBMP's demand of ₹69 lakh from 150-year-old school
162.article_body: The Karnataka High Court quashed Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike's (BBMP) notice demanding ₹69 lakh from 150-year-old Good Shepherd Convent school and said that the demand has "no legal legs to stand". In 2014, the school made application to BBMP seeking licence to construct four additional floors and paid ₹1,61,438 as scrutiny fee but BBMP demanded ₹69 lakh as betterment charge.

163.title: I competed with myself in bettering what I did last: Jaaved on his projects
163.article_body: Speaking about his career choices, Jaaved Jaaferi said, "I wanted to be happy with what I was doing. Most of the work I did, I did connect to it but sometimes you do things as you need to do it." "I...competed with myself in bettering what I did last," he added. Jaaved further said now he wants to do better.

164.title: People within Cong have no faith in party: Owaisi on Hardik Patel's exit
164.article_body: Reacting to Hardik Patel's departure from Congress ahead of Gujarat Assembly polls, AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi said that those within Congress don't have any faith in party. "Congress ruled Maharashtra for 15 years but now...party has slipped to third position...Congress is nowhere to be seen in Delhi," he added. Patel resigned as working president of Congress' Gujarat unit earlier today.

165.title: No matter what size you are, people will discuss it: Sonakshi on body shaming
165.article_body: During an interview, actress Sonakshi Sinha said both she and actress Huma Qureshi have faced body and weight-shaming for years during the initial years of their careers. "It happened from the beginning of our careers in this line and it still happens. It hasn't stopped," she added. "No matter what size you are, people are always discussing it," Sonakshi said.

166.title: Rahul Tripathi should be in the mix for Team India: Ravi Shastri
166.article_body: Ex-India coach Ravi Shastri has said SRH batter Rahul Tripathi is "not far" from receiving an India call-up. He added, "If someone gets injured, this guy can be slotted in straight away...Rahul Tripathi is a dangerous player and should be in the mix." Shastri further said, "If he's performing season after season, I'm sure the selectors will be watching."

167.title: It is good that Hardik Patel left the party: Gujarat Cong incharge
167.article_body: Gujarat Congress incharge Raghu Sharma on Wednesday said it was good that Hardik Patel left the party as Patel's personal ambitions were larger than Congress' ideology. Sharma said Hardik was insecure of losing his space in the party if Rajkot-based businessman Naresh Patel joined the party. Hardik resigned from Congress' primary membership on Wednesday.

168.title: ITBP rescues 2 trekkers, stranded for over 48 hours in U'khand
168.article_body: A team of the Indo-Tibetan Border Police (ITBP) rescued two trekkers, who were stranded for over 48 hours, during an expedition in Uttarakhand's Pithoragarh, a senior officer said on Wednesday. Vishal Gangwar and Santosh Kumar started their trek to Khaliya Top on Sunday and got stranded near Birthi fall in Munsiyari. They are being brought to safety through land route.

169.title: Big mistake: Mackie on Kim Kardashian wearing Marilyn Monroe's gown
169.article_body: Designer Bob Mackie, speaking about Kim Kardashian wearing Marilyn Monroe's gown at Met Gala, said, "I thought it was a big mistake." "[Marilyn] was a goddess. A crazy goddess, but a goddess...it was done for her. It was designed for her. Nobody else should be seen in that dress," he added. Kim had worn Marilyn's original 1962 Jean Louis gown.

170.title: Kareena is very polite & down to earth: Chef who cooked for her in Kalimpong
170.article_body: Kareena Kapoor, who has been shooting in Kalimpong for Sujoy Ghosh's 'Devotion of Suspect X', posted stories about a bakery in the hills named Neena's Kitchen. She tagged one of the dishes as the "best meal ever" and also praised the dessert. Reacting to it, chef Neena who cooked for her said, "Kareena is very polite and down to earth."

171.title: 19-yr-old man enters 13-yr-old relative's house, rapes her in Pune; booked
171.article_body: Pune Police have booked a 19-year-old man for allegedly raping his 13-year-old relative. According to police, the accused and the victim stay in the same neighbourhood. The FIR based on the complaint filed, said that the man entered the girl's house when her family was away and took advantage of the absence of her family.

172.title: Bhagyashree breaks down at son Abhimanyu's 'Nikamma' trailer launch
172.article_body: Actress Bhagyashree got emotional at the trailer launch of her son Abhimanyu Dassani's film 'Nikamma'. She added, "He has put a lot of effort into this film. The shooting of this film...went on for two years during COVID-19." "He has done...[a] good work [and]...worked so hard...Just keep this nikamma in your heart," Bhagyashree said.

173.title: Heart-rending: PM Modi after 12 die in Guj wall collapse incident
173.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Wednesday condoled the loss of lives after 12 labourers were killed when a wall of a factory collapsed in the Morbi district of Gujarat. Taking to Twitter, PM Modi said, "The tragedy in Morbi caused by a wall collapse is heart-rending." He further announced an ex-gratia of ₹2 lakh each for the families of the deceased.

174.title: Special arrangements made for animals at Tanday Deer Park amid rising heat
