174.article_body: Special arrangements have been made for the animals at Tanday Rakh and Mantalai Deer Park in Jammu and Kashmir's Udhampur during summer. "With the prolonged dry spell and forest fires, we ensure to enrich their diet; provide watermelon, cucumber, agro-feed, green fodder and 24-hour water supply," a forest guard said. "We sprinkle water in sheds to cool them," he added.

175.title: Taliban ask female UN staffers to wear hijab, say will monitor
175.article_body: The Taliban-led government of Afghanistan has reportedly issued a statement asking female staff members of the UN Assistance Mission in Afghanistan (UNAMA) to wear hijab. The Ministry of Propagation of Virtue and Prevention of Vice said that its personnel will stand outside the UNAMA office to monitor if the women are wearing hijab or not.

176.title: Will retain neutral status: Austria after Sweden-Finland NATO bid
176.article_body: Austrian Foreign Minister Alexander Schallenberg said Austria would retain its neutral status even as Sweden and Finland overhauled decades-long foreign policy stances to apply for NATO membership amid Russia's invasion of Ukraine. Schallenberg added that Austria, which obtains 80% of its natural gas from Russia, would continue to provide humanitarian support to Ukraine rather than lethal weapons.

177.title: Matthew Mott appointed England men's white-ball team head coach
177.article_body: Former Australia Women coach Matthew Mott has been appointed the head coach of England men's white-ball cricket team. He has been appointed on a contract of four years. Under Mott, Australia Women won consecutive T20 World Cups and one 50-over World Cup, went four Ashes series undefeated and also set the world record for most consecutive ODI victories (26).

178.title: Hadn't hiked prices for Kabir Singh, it did over ₹270 cr at box office: Producer
178.article_body: 'Kabir Singh' producer Murad Khetani said that the ticket prices were not hiked for the movie. "It did over ₹270 crore at the box office. The footfalls of Kabir Singh are higher than the biggest blockbusters of 2019. I believe, if your film is good, it ends up collecting well at the box office," he added.

179.title: Deepika, others dance as Mame Khan sings at inauguration of India Pavilion at Cannes
179.article_body: Folk artist Mame Khan sang during the inauguration of India Pavilion at the 75th Cannes Film Festival. A video of his performance was shared by Union Minister Anurag Thakur on Twitter. Actresses Deepika Padukone, Urvashi Rautela, Tamannaah Bhatia and Pooja Hegde were seen dancing in the video as Khan sang.

180.title: One day, India won't have to be at Cannes, Cannes will be in India: Deepika
180.article_body: Actress Deepika Padukone, during the inauguration of the India Pavilion at the 75th Cannes Film Festival, said, "There will come a day, I truly believe, where India won't have to be at Cannes, [but] Cannes will be in India." She added, "We have a long way to go as a country...we have the talent, the ability...we just need that conviction."

181.title: Mushfiqur beats Tamim to become first Bangladesh batter to reach 5,000 Test runs
181.article_body: Mushfiqur Rahim has beaten Tamim Iqbal in the race to reach 5,000 Test runs, becoming the first Bangladesh batter to reach the milestone. Rahim achieved the feat during his 105-run knock in Bangladesh's first innings in first Test against Sri Lanka. He has scored 5,037 Test runs. Tamim, who scored 133 runs in the innings, has scored 4,981 Test runs.

182.title: Traffic constable breaks down after BJP MLA's relatives drag him to police station in UP
182.article_body: A video clip of a traffic police constable breaking down at a police station in Uttar Pradesh's Unnao has gone viral. According to reports, some people claiming to be relatives of BJP MLA Ashutosh Shukla dragged the constable to the station after he stopped their SUV with a hooter and BJP flag. The accused allegedly threatened him with dire consequences.

183.title: Depp said, 'We're married now, I can punch Amber in face': Amber's friend
183.article_body: Amber Heard's friend iO Tillett Wright, in pre-recorded testimony played in court, recalled his conversation with Johnny Depp at the couple's wedding in February 2015 in the Bahamas. "Depp said, 'We're married now. I can punch her (Amber) in the face...nobody can do anything about it'," claimed Wright. Earlier, Amber had alleged that Depp hit her during their honeymoon.

184.title: It was runaway hit, I played 40-year-old Champu at 22: Neena on Marathi play
184.article_body: Actress Neena Kulkarni took to Instagram to share her picture from the back page of the printed classic Marathi play 'Mahasagar'. "I remember I was stoked to be on the cover! All of 22 years then, I played role of a 40-year-old Champu. It was a runaway hit...800 odd shows! And it had a super cast," she wrote.

185.title: Tesla to show sneak preview of humanoid Tesla Bot on AI Day in Aug
185.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has confirmed in a tweet that the firm will be showing a sneak preview of its humanoid Tesla Bot in August. The preview will be shown on August 19, when Tesla is holding its second AI Day. "The purpose of AI Day is to convince great AI/software/chip talent to join Tesla," Musk had tweeted earlier.

186.title: I want to be known as the woman who lived her life queen-sized: Malaika Arora
186.article_body: Actress Malaika describes her childhood as 'tumultuous'. She said that her tough times also taught her some important lessons. "Those early lessons are the cornerstones of my life and professional journey. I am still fiercely independent; I value my freedom," she added. Malaika further said that she wants to be known as the woman who lived her life queen-sized.

187.title: Change of pace, length is what makes Arshdeep stand out: Ian Bishop
187.article_body: Ex-WI fast bowler Ian Bishop has said PBKS pacer Arshdeep Singh's "change of pace and length" makes him stand out among the young pacers in the ongoing IPL season. "Arshdeep has good accuracy and a great feel for knowing when to bowl what type of delivery," explained Bishop. So far, Arshdeep has picked 10 wickets in 13 games.

188.title: Kolkata port to export 4,000 tonnes of wheat to B'desh amid export ban
188.article_body: Kolkata's Syama Prasad Mookerjee Port is set to export 4,000 tonnes of wheat to Bangladesh by May 13 amid the Centre's wheat export ban order. Notably, Centre relaxed its previous order on Tuesday, stating that consignments handed over to customs on or prior to May 13 would be allowed for export. India has halted wheat exports to ensure food security.

189.title: Sri Lankan police arrest 2 ruling party lawmakers over mob violence
189.article_body: Sri Lankan police have arrested two ruling party lawmakers for allegedly instigating mob violence that plunged the country into days of unrest and left nine people dead and over 200 injured last week. "There is direct evidence against the...MPs," an official said. Sanath Nishantha and Milan Jayathilake were among several politicians banned from leaving Sri Lanka over May 9 violence.

190.title: UK inflation hits 9% in April, its highest level since 1982
190.article_body: Consumer price inflation in the United Kingdom reached 9% in April 2022, its highest level since 1982. British Finance Minister Rishi Sunak said countries around the world were being hit by high inflation and the jump in inflation in UK reflected the increase in regulated energy tariffs. "We cannot protect people completely from these global challenges," Sunak said.

191.title: Rupee closes at a new all-time low of 77.58 against US dollar
191.article_body: The Indian rupee closed at a new all-time low of 77.58 against the US dollar on Wednesday. The Indian rupee had closed at 77.47 against the US dollar on Tuesday. Meanwhile, the stock market slipped into the red, halting a two-day upward trend. Sensex settled at 54,209 points, while the Nifty stood at 16,240 points.

192.title: HC seeks Delhi govt's reply on making Yoga Science compulsory till Class 8
192.article_body: The Delhi High Court has sought a response from the Centre, Delhi government and NCERT on a PIL to make Health and Yoga Science compulsory for students till Class 8. The petitioner has submitted that the Right to Health and Right to Education are complementary and supplementary to each other. He said yoga is a medical and life science.

193.title: It was luck that 19th over vs MI turned out to be maiden: Bhuvneshwar
193.article_body: SRH's Bhuvneshwar Kumar, while interacting with Umran Malik, said that it was "luck" that the 19th over against MI turned out to be maiden. "I felt the yorker was the best option on that wicket to prevent run-scoring...Luckily, all deliveries landed in a good spot," he added. MI needed 19 off 12 to win when Bhuvneshwar bowled the maiden over.

194.title: Trump's social media firm may raise $50 mn before SPAC deal closes
194.article_body: Former US President Donald Trump's social media venture has said it may raise up to $50 million through convertible notes before it merges with a blank-check acquisition firm, filings revealed. TMTG raised $38.2 million through issuance of convertible promissory notes, as of March 31. TMTG is set to receive $1.25 billion in funding once it merges with Digital World Acquisition.

195.title: Stones hurled at Dalit man's marriage procession over DJ music in MP
195.article_body: A Dalit man's marriage procession was allegedly attacked by few people in MP's Rajgarh district, following a dispute over DJ music being played during the celebration, which left three people injured. The procession was passing outside a mosque at around 11 pm, when some people of a community objected to DJ music being played during the celebration, the police said.

196.title: IndiGo names Pieter Elbers as CEO, Ronojoy Dutta to retire
196.article_body: IndiGo on Wednesday announced the appointment of Pieter Elbers as the airline's CEO, subject to regulatory approvals. The 52-year-old will join IndiGo on or before October 1, 2022, and will succeed 71-year-old Ronojoy Dutta, who has decided to retire on September 30, 2022. Since 2014, Elbers has served as the President & CEO of KLM Royal Dutch Airlines.

197.title: Guy emptied my pouch, stole money, cards at a Europe train station: Kangana
197.article_body: Actress Kangana Ranaut recalled that she was robbed by a person at a train station in Europe during one of her trips. "I had a Louis Vuitton pouch and a backpack. The guy was so sharp, he came and stole my money, a few thousand dollars...cards...I noticed that he'd emptied my pouch...my passport was with me," she said.

198.title: Hindu College professor booked over post on Shivling, says 'didn't expect threats'
198.article_body: Ratan Lal, an assistant professor from Delhi University's Hindu College, has been booked over an alleged derogatory Facebook post referring to claims of a Shivling being found at the Gyanvapi mosque. "I was not expecting threats and abuses for this statement...In our country, religious feelings get hurt over anything," Lal said after the complaint. He has sought police protection.

199.title: Ex-Tripura CM Biplab Deb named in 'fake CIA report', wife files complaint
199.article_body: Former Tripura CM Biplab Kumar Deb's wife filed a police complaint alleging that a fake Central Intelligence Agency (CIA) report is being circulated on social media in the name of her husband. It is being circulated to infringe the security of the nation as a result of a deep-rooted conspiracy, she claimed. Deb on Saturday resigned as Tripura CM.

200.title: Love how everyone seems to know more about my life than me: Arjun amid wedding rumours
200.article_body: After rumours of his wedding with actress Malaika Arora, actor Arjun Kapoor took to his Instagram Stories to say that he loves how everyone seems to know more about his life than he does. Media reports had earlier said that Malaika and Arjun will have a winter wedding this year. Recently, he had also said people in India love gossiping.

201.title: BJP wants to take India back to 1990s when riots ensued: Owaisi
201.article_body: Speaking about the Gyanvapi Mosque case, AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi on Wednesday said that the BJP wants to take the country back to the 1990s when riots ensued. "It's a fountain (inside the mosque)," Owaisi added. "If it happens like this then all the fountains of the Taj Mahal must be shut down," he stated.

202.title: Karnataka CM Bommai inspects rain-affected areas in Bengaluru
202.article_body: Amid heavy rainfall in Bengaluru, Karnataka Chief Minister Basavaraj Bommai on Wednesday inspected the rain-affected areas in the state capital. BJP National General Secretary CT Ravi, state ministers R Ashoka and Munirathna also accompanied the CM during the inspection. Bengaluru saw heavy rains on Tuesday night, which led to severe flooding in many areas of the city.

203.title: Another suspect involved in robbing temples in Canada arrested
203.article_body: The Canadian police have arrested a fourth suspect in connection with the multiple incidents of robberies and vandalisations of religious places, which mainly included Hindu temples. The accused has been identified as Gurdeep Pandher, a 37-year-old resident of Brampton town. As many as 13 such incidents were reported between November 2021 and March 2022 in Ontario.

204.title: I'm scared with money after financial lows, always looking to save: Divyanka
204.article_body: Television actress Divyanka Tripathi said that she is always scared with money and is always looking to save. "Especially when you have seen too many lows...it's that way with me," she added. Divyanka also mentioned that her father was skeptical about her joining the industry and that he came and stayed with her for a week.

205.title: BBMP estimates 1,000 houses flooded amid rains in B'luru: Report
205.article_body: Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) has estimated that around 1,000 houses have been flooded due to the heavy rains in the city, according to a report. Two labourers have reportedly died amid heavy rainfall in the city on Wednesday. Meanwhile, the IMD has issued an orange alert for Bengaluru, predicting heavy rainfall for the next four-five days in the city.

206.title: Calcutta HC asks Partha Chatterjee to appear before CBI over SSC case
206.article_body: The Calcutta High Court on Wednesday ordered West Bengal Minister and TMC leader Partha Chatterjee to appear before CBI by 6 pm today in connection with the alleged SSC recruitment irregularities. The order came after a division bench of court upheld the orders of a single bench on Wednesday that directed the CBI to inquire into alleged illegal appointments.

207.title: 2 critically injured after falling from Delhi's Nirman Bhawan building
207.article_body: Two people were critically injured after one of them allegedly fell from the sixth floor of the under-renovation Nirman Bhawan building in Delhi on Wednesday. The labourers received injuries on their head and hands, a fire department official said. The fire department rushed four fire tenders to the spot after receiving a call about the incident at 12:38 pm.

208.title: Depp told me about rage activities with Winona & Kate: Amber's friend
208.article_body: Amber Heard's friend iO Tillett Wright, in pre-recorded testimony played in court, said Johnny Depp had told him he experienced "great bouts of jealousy" in his relationships. Wright added Depp said it led to "a lot of drinking...a lot of rage activities". "Depp told me...that happened with...Winona Ryder....Kate Moss," Wright said. "Depp told me...that happened with Vanessa Paradis," he stated.

209.title: I'd love to recreate my iconic look of 'Poo' from 'Kabhi Khushi...': Kareena
209.article_body: In a recent interview, when actress Kareena Kapoor was asked which iconic look from her films she'd like to recreate, Kareena said, "Since 'Poo' from 'Kabhi Khushi Kabhie Gham' is one of my most iconic characters, I would love to recreate that look of mine." Meanwhile, on the work front, Kareena has begun shooting for Sujoy Ghosh's next.

210.title: Inflation, unemployment making new records: Sachin Pilot criticises Centre
210.article_body: Congress leader Sachin Pilot targeted the BJP-led central government over rising inflation and unemployment in the country. "Inflation and unemployment are making new records day by day under the directionless and failed governance of the central government," he tweeted. "With...wholesale inflation registering 15.08% in...April, inflation...has reached the highest level of 24 years," he added.

211.title: Mahinda makes 1st appearance in Sri Lankan parliament since quitting as PM
211.article_body: Ex-Sri Lankan PM Mahinda Rajapaksa made his first appearance in parliament on Wednesday since stepping down as PM amid economic crisis. This comes a day after no-confidence motion against his brother and President Gotabaya Rajapaksa was defeated in parliament. Mahinda Rajapaksa sought refuge at naval base last week as his house was set ablaze by protesters amid clashes.

212.title: Ratan Tata visits Taj Hotel in Nano without bodyguards; video goes viral
212.article_body: Tata Sons Chairman Emeritus Ratan Tata was spotted visiting Taj Hotel in his Tata Nano without any bodyguard accompanying him, a video shared by Viral Bhayani showed. Bhayani said that Ratan Tata was escorted by the hotel staff. Several people praised him on social media, with a social media user saying, "Exemplary simplicity personified."

213.title: No one has ever won battle against farmers: Sidhu to Punjab CM
213.article_body: Following a protest staged by Punjab farmers near the Chandigarh-Mohali border on Tuesday, Congress’ Navjot Singh Sidhu urged Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann to "amicably" settle their issues. "No one has ever won a battle against the farmers," Sidhu tweeted on Wednesday. "Urge you not to go on a collision course with farmers...who are the backbone of Punjab’s economy," Sidhu added.

214.title: Top engineer who quit Apple over return-to-office policy joins Google: Report
214.article_body: Ian Goodfellow, who quit as Apple's Director of Machine Learning over the company's return-to-office policy, is joining Google parent Alphabet's AI unit DeepMind, Bloomberg reported. He worked in different capacities for Google since 2013, before joining Apple in 2019. He's best known for inventing Generative Adversarial Networks (GANs), a class of machine learning frameworks.

215.title: UFOs spotted 400 times by US military, reveals US govt
215.article_body: The US military has had 11 close encounters with UFOs, a top Pentagon intelligence official has told Congress. In the first public hearing of its kind in over half a century, intelligence chiefs revealed they had recorded around 400 UFO sightings in total. Senior Pentagon officials said no evidence of extraterrestrial origins had been discovered so far.

216.title: Everyone is newborn care specialist: Nick Jonas on receiving parenting advice
216.article_body: When asked if people have been giving him advice on how to care for his newborn daughter, Malti, singer Nick Jonas said, "Turns out everybody I know is a newborn care specialist, all these PhDs I didn't know they had." When asked how his brothers have reacted to the baby's arrival, Nick said, "Amazing. They got kids of their own."

217.title: Even the biggest of players can struggle: Ishan on his form in IPL 2022
217.article_body: Talking about his form in the ongoing IPL season, MI opener Ishan Kishan said that even the best of cricketers can "struggle" at some point. He added, "I have seen the likes of Chris Gayle taking time (to start hitting)...Some day, you get a good start, some day, opposition bowlers come prepared." Ishan has scored 370 runs in 13 games.

218.title: These allegations are written by BJP: Cong MP on Hardik’s resignation
218.article_body: Soon after Hardik Patel resigned from primary membership of Congress saying that the party only played the role of a "roadblock", party leader Shaktisinh Gohil said that these allegations are written down by BJP. These allegations have not been made by someone who has quit Congress, Gohil added. "They just speak it out loud," Gohil stated.

219.title: T'gana govt owes Hyd civic body ₹5,258 cr in property taxes: RTI reply
219.article_body: The Telangana government owes the Hyderabad civic body ₹5,258 crore in property taxes, as per an RTI response. Some of the dues are pending for nearly 25 years, The Print reported. The police department has not paid dues of ₹420 crore for 12 years and the medical department owes ₹1,185 crore over the last 23 years, the RTI reply added.

220.title: Apple delays plan requiring employees to come to office 3 days a week
220.article_body: Apple has delayed its plan that required its employees to come to the office three days a week, according to a memo seen by Bloomberg. Apple said that the requirement is being delayed "for the time being", without providing a new date. The technology company still requires its employees to come to the office two days a week.

221.title: Give central contract to Umran Malik straight away: Ravi Shastri
221.article_body: Ex-India head coach Ravi Shastri has said that the BCCI should give central contract to SRH fast bowler Umran Malik "straight away". "Don't let him float around...keep him in the mix with the main players and let him learn by being around the Shamis and Bumrahs," Shastri added about the 22-year-old cricketer, who is the fastest bowler in IPL 2022.

222.title: Russian gymnast Kuliak banned for 1 year for wearing 'Z' war symbol on chest at World Cup
222.article_body: Russian gymnast Ivan Kuliak has been given a one-year ban for wearing 'Z' national war symbol on the podium at Apparatus World Cup in Qatar in March. Kuliak earned bronze in parallel bars final and displayed a letter 'Z' taped to his chest as he stood next to gold medallist, Ukraine's Illia Kovtun. He'll also have to return his medal.

223.title: 'Excuse me?' Amber after Depp's lawyer claims she got Aquaman due to actor
223.article_body: Amber Heard has denied the claim that Johnny Depp got her the role of Mera in 'Aquaman'. Depp's lawyer Camille Vasquez, while cross-examining Heard during the trial, suggested Amber got 'Aquaman' due to Depp. To this, Amber said, "Excuse me? No...I got myself that role by auditioning." Earlier, Amber had said she "fought hard" to stay in 'Aquaman 2'.

224.title: Won't arrest MP Navneet Rana, her husband till June 9: Mumbai Police
224.article_body: Mumbai Police told a court they would not arrest Amravati MP Navneet Rana and her MLA-husband Ravi Rana till June 9 in connection with Hanuman Chalisa case. June 9 is the date of hearing on police's plea seeking their bail cancellation. Rana and her husband were arrested after they had announced to recite Hanuman Chalisa outside Uddhav Thackeray's private residence.

225.title: No plans to block YouTube or cut ourselves off from internet: Russia
225.article_body: Russia's minister of communications Maksut Shadayev said Russia is not planning to shut YouTube in the country. He said that such a move would likely see Russian users suffer and should therefore be avoided. He added Russia doesn't want to cut itself off from global internet infrastructure, saying, "We think that Russia should remain a part of the global network."

226.title: Horatti resigns as chief of K'taka Legislative Council, joins BJP
226.article_body: Former senior JD(S) leader Basavaraj Horatti on Wednesday joined the BJP after resigning as the Chairman of Karnataka Legislative Council and MLC. He joined the BJP in the presence of Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai and BJP National General Secretary CT Ravi, among others. "[Horatti's] joining has strengthened the party...We'll...give him all the opportunities and respects he deserves," Bommai said.

227.title: Jamia Millia Islamia PG students stage protest against offline exams
227.article_body: A group of students pursuing postgraduate courses in Jamia Millia Islamia (JMI) on Tuesday gathered in front of the office of the university's proctor and staged a protest against offline exams. The students raised slogans demanding that exams should be conducted online. Meanwhile, the university said as classes were conducted offline, the exams will also be conducted in physical mode.

228.title: 2 sisters, mother poison family over their objection to girls' marriage with boyfriends
228.article_body: Noida police have arrested five people including two sisters, their mother and their boyfriends for allegedly attempting to poison their family. Police said the sisters laced the dinner of four family members with a poisonous substance because of their objection to their marriage with their boyfriends. The victims were rushed to hospital after another family member found them unconscious.

229.title: Johnny Depp smiles as Amber Heard's lawyer imitates his voice, video viral
229.article_body: In a video that has been shared by several internet users, Johnny Depp can be seen smiling after Amber Heard's lawyer is heard imitating his voice. While talking about Depp not looking at Amber during her testimony, Amber's attorney Elaine Bredehoft can be heard saying, "She played...a tape...where Johnny said, 'You will not see my...eyes again'. Do you...recall that?"

230.title: Ayodhya Ram temple construction on schedule, says authority
230.article_body: The construction of Ram Temple in Ayodhya is going as per schedule, an official statement said. Temple construction committee chairman Nripendra Misra said that the ground floor 'garbha griha' (sanctum sanctorum) will be complete by December 2023, while the remaining work will be done by December 2024. The construction of the plinth is expected to be completed by August 2022.

231.title: Ruchi Soya to acquire Patanjali's food retail business for ₹690 crore
231.article_body: Ruchi Soya on Wednesday said it'll be acquiring Patanjali Ayurved's food retail business for an amount of consideration of ₹690 crore. Post-acquisition, Ruchi Soya will be called 'Patanjali Foods' and will acquire Patanjali Ayurved's manufacturing plants in Padartha (Uttarakhand) and Newasa (Maharashtra). In 2019, Baba Ramdev's Patanjali had acquired Ruchi Soya through an insolvency process.

232.title: 4, including 2 children, missing from Pune found dead at Alibaug lodge
232.article_body: A 25-year-old woman, her two children, and a 29-year-old man who had gone missing from the Pune district on May 2 were found dead inside a tourist cottage in Alibaug on Tuesday afternoon. Police suspect the man and woman, who were allegedly in an extra-marital relationship, poisoned the three-year-old boy and five-year-old girl and then died by suicide by hanging.

233.title: LSG will undoubtedly target Shreyas with bouncers: Shastri
233.article_body: Ex-India head coach Ravi Shastri has said KKR captain Shreyas Iyer will have to "give himself time" to score runs in their final league match against LSG on Wednesday. Shastri added that LSG will "undoubtedly" target him with short balls and he'll have to show his "readiness against it". Shreyas is KKR's top run-getter with 351 runs in 13 games.

234.title: India test fires first indigenously developed naval anti-ship missile
234.article_body: Indian Navy on Wednesday successfully carried out the maiden test firing of the first indigenously developed naval anti-ship missile from a Seaking 42B helicopter, officials said. "This firing is a significant step towards achieving self-reliance in niche missile technology and reaffirms the Indian Navy's commitment to indigenisation," said a senior Navy official. The test was conducted in Odisha.

235.title: 2 booked for extortion threat of ₹10.85 crore to Pune builder
235.article_body: Pune's Hinjewadi Police have booked two persons for allegedly demanding a bribe of ₹10.85 crore from a city-based builder. The accused, identified as Chandu Laxmandas Ramnani and Kiran Chandu Ramnani, allegedly accused the builder of committing fraud by not having disclosed type of land he was carrying out construction on. Police have booked the accused under relevant sections of IPC.

236.title: Registration for K'taka govt's mango farm trips to start soon: Official
236.article_body: The Karnataka State Mango Development and Marketing Corporation Limited will soon begin registration for mango-picking tourism on its website. Mango tours to farms will be held on Sundays wherein the corporation will take people to the mango farms in the Ramanagara or Kolar districts from Bengaluru. Farmers sell fruits at a lesser price during the tour, an official said.

237.title: I'm trying to learn from every situation: Rahul Tripathi on 76(44) vs MI
237.article_body: SRH batter Rahul Tripathi, who scored 76(44) against MI on Tuesday, said he enjoyed batting at number three and he's trying to learn from every situation. On facing Jasprit Bumrah, Tripathi said, "Bumrah's a great bowler...and I was just looking to react to whatever he's bowling. Depends on how the wicket is playing, how I can counterattack at that point."

238.title: Newly married man loses hand as gift from sister-in-law's ex-lover explodes in Gujarat
238.article_body: A newly married man and his three-year-old nephew were critically injured after a wedding gift, which he allegedly received from his sister-in-law's ex-boyfriend, exploded in Gujarat's Navsari district. Apart from suffering severe injuries to his arms, head and eyes, his right wrist was cut off from the arm. A police complaint has been filed by his family.

239.title: Fire breaks out near judges' chamber in Delhi court, no one injured
239.article_body: A fire broke out near a chamber of judges on the second floor of the Rohini Court in Delhi on Wednesday. No injuries were reported in the incident, officials said, adding that five fire tenders were sent to the spot. The blaze started in an air-conditioner in a room near the judges' chamber, Delhi Fire Service Director Atul Garg said.

240.title: Iran seizes foreign ship with smuggled fuel, detains crew members
240.article_body: Authorities in Iran have seized a foreign ship attempting to smuggle fuel out of the country and detained its crew members, state news agency IRNA reported on Wednesday. The ship, carrying over 5,50,000 litres of smuggled fuel, was seized in Gulf waters, the agency added. Iranian authorities have detained several ships in recent months for smuggling fuel in the Gulf.

241.title: Cong will be tail party in India, regional parties will take lead: TRS MLC
241.article_body: TRS MLC Kavitha Kalvakuntla reacted to Congress leader Rahul Gandhi's remarks on regional parties and said his party will become a "tail party" in the country in future and regional parties will take lead. "Regional parties have a clear agenda for people. Rahulji should understand that even in Maharashtra they're in power because of a regional party there," Kavitha added.

242.title: One must do things the India way to be profitable there: Stellantis
242.article_body: Stellantis CEO Carlos Tavares has said that western automakers can be profitable in India if they do things the "India way". He added that amid global disruption in Europe and China, India has a "bigger opportunity" to grow in the global automotive industry as well as within Stellantis. The firm will be launching its first EV in India next year.

243.title: In extortion bid, 4 goons set petrol pump on fire in Bihar's Gaya
243.article_body: Four goons allegedly set a petrol pump afire in an extortion bid in Bihar's Gaya. According to the employees, the goons, who arrived on two bikes, asked them to fill their tanks and refused to pay. Instead, they demanded extortion from them. When denied, they set the pump's vending nozzles, a parked school bus and bike on fire and fled.

244.title: Gujarat Congress busy ensuring chicken sandwich delivery for Delhi leaders: Hardik
244.article_body: Hardik Patel, who resigned as Gujarat Congress working president and left the Congress party on Wednesday, in his resignation letter claimed that big Congress leaders in Gujarat were "far away from issues of Gujarat". He added, "They are more focussed on ensuring that chicken sandwich for leaders who have come from Delhi is delivered on time!"

245.title: Researcher shows way Teslas could be unlocked using vulnerability
245.article_body: NCC Group researcher Sultan Qasim Khan has demonstrated the way he unlocked a Tesla using a vulnerability he said Tesla has been informed about. He unlocked a 2020 Tesla Model 3 using a vulnerability in the BLE technology on which the entry system relies. He added any smart locks using BLE technology could be unlocked in the same way.

246.title: 2 friends drown in Saharanpur's Yamuna canal while bathing
246.article_body: Two friends reportedly drowned in the Yamuna canal at Uttar Pradesh's Saharanpur, police said on Tuesday. Yuvraj (20) and Devesh (21), along with another person, went to take a bath in the canal but accidentally moved to the deeper side. While locals managed to save the third person, the two deceased were washed away in the strong current, police said.

247.title: Criticising RBI for delayed rate hike is unfair: Ex-RBI Governor
247.article_body: Ex-RBI Governor D Subbarao on Wednesday said criticism that RBI is behind the delayed interest rate hike is unfair. "With credit growth currently only around 9-10%, the recent repo rate hike is unlikely to transmit very strongly," Subbarao said. Unlike most large economies, India is structurally supply-constrained and that itself is a safety valve for India against stagflation, he added.

248.title: Heat wave warning issued for several states over 5 days, IMD releases list
248.article_body: The IMD has issued heat wave warning for several states over five days. Heat wave conditions will likely be witnessed in Rajasthan, Punjab, Haryana and Madhya Pradesh on May 19 and 20. Maharashtra will likely witness heat wave conditions from May 18 to 21. Meanwhile, heat wave conditions are likely in Uttar Pradesh today and over Odisha on May 22.

249.title: BJP trying to divert attention from unemployment, inflation: Mayawati on Gyanvapi case
249.article_body: Reacting to the Gyanvapi mosque controversy, BSP chief Mayawati said that BJP and its associates are targeting religious places to divert people's attention from unemployment and inflation. "Years after independence, the manner in which religious sentiments of people are being instigated under a conspiracy, under the pretext of Gyanvapi, Mathura...will not strengthen the country," she added.

250.title: Wall collapses at salt factory in Gujarat's Morbi, at least 12 workers killed
250.article_body: At least 12 labourers were killed after a wall of a salt factory collapsed in the Morbi district of Gujarat on Wednesday, an official said. Several people are feared trapped under the debris. A rescue operation has been started and the injured persons have been shifted to a nearby hospital.

251.title: Historic day: MP CM on SC's nod to OBC reservation in local body polls
251.article_body: Reacting to Supreme Court's decision giving approval to OBC reservation in MP's local body polls, CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan said, "It's a historic day. Satyamev Jayate!" "It has been proven again that truth can't lose," he added. It was because of the Congress that it was earlier directed that polls would be held without OBC reservation, he further said.

252.title: Vedantu lays off 424 employees, CEO says 'I am truly sorry'
252.article_body: Bengaluru-based edtech startup Vedantu is laying off 424 of its 5,900 employees. "I am truly sorry," Vedantu CEO Vamsi Krishna told laid-off employees. In an e-mail to all Vedantu employees, he wrote, "External environment is tough. War in Europe, impending recession fears, and Fed rate interest hikes have led to inflationary pressures with massive correction in stocks...capital will be scarce."

253.title: Depp knows he's lying, I survived that man & I'm able to look at him: Amber
253.article_body: Amber Heard, when asked about Johnny Depp not looking at her during her testimony, said that he knows he is guilty and lying. "Otherwise why can't he look at me...I survived that man...and I'm able to look at him," Heard said. Depp's lawyer had asked Heard if it was true that actor promised that she'd never see his eyes again.

254.title: US approves COVID-19 vaccine booster for children aged 5 to 11
254.article_body: The United States has approved the administration of Pfizer's COVID-19 vaccine booster dose for children aged from five to 11 years. The US Food and Drug Administration said that the move will provide continued protection against COVID-19. The children in this age group will be given a low-dose shot of 10 micrograms, compared to 30 microgram doses for older people.

255.title: We intend to close the transaction and enforce Musk merger agreement: Twitter board
255.article_body: Twitter Inc's board said it plans to enforce its $44 billion agreement to be bought by Elon Musk, saying the transaction is in the best interest of all shareholders. "We intend to close the transaction," the board said on Tuesday in a statement to Bloomberg News. The proposed takeover includes a $1 billion breakup fee for each party.

256.title: Plea seeking demolition of Gyanvapi Mosque wall to be heard today
256.article_body: A plea seeking the demolition of a wall beneath the wazu khana of the Gyanvapi Mosque will be heard by a Varanasi court on Wednesday. Advocate Vishnu Jain, appearing for the petitioners, said that they want the wall to be demolished and that they should be allowed to go there. He added the court will pronounce its verdict today itself.

257.title: I was named after Abhishek Bachchan, had to change my name due to him: Krushna
257.article_body: Comedian-actor Krushna Abhishek revealed his mother, who was Amitabh Bachchan's fan, named him after the actor's son, Abhishek Bachchan. He said, "My name had to be changed and made Krushna, also because of Abhishek." "When I got into acting, I was told there's...an actor by the name of Abhishek...they told me not to keep my name as Abhishek," he added.

258.title: UK MP arrested over rape & sex offences spanning 7 years
258.article_body: The UK Police have arrested an unnamed Conservative MP on suspicion of rape and sexual assault. The man is in his fifties and the investigation into the alleged offences, which took place between 2002 and 2009, is ongoing, police said. The man also faces allegations of abuse of position of trust and misconduct in a public office.

259.title: Rahul Tripathi has got some real potential: Matthew Hayden
259.article_body: Former Australia opener Matthew Hayden has praised SRH batter Rahul Tripathi, stating that the 31-year-old has "real potential to go all the way at the international level". Hayden added, "He is someone [who] is a dangerous striker of the ball, he can hit both sides of the wicket." Tripathi scored his third fifty of IPL 2022 against MI on Tuesday.

260.title: Video shows Heard, Franco in elevator night before she filed for divorce from Depp
260.article_body: Footage has emerged of Hollywood actor James Franco visiting Amber Heard at her apartment the night before she filed for divorce from Johnny Depp. The footage, showing Heard and Franco in an elevator, was played to jurors in the courthouse. Heard confirmed that it was Franco in the video and that they were going to her penthouse.

261.title: I used to pull a truck for 8 km: Shoaib Akhtar on how he breached 160-kmph bowling speed
261.article_body: Talking about how he breached 160-kmph bowling speed, former Pakistan fast bowler Shoaib Akhtar said that he used to pull vehicles. "I began by running with tyres...Next, I started pulling small vehicles with my shoulders...[at night in Islamabad]," he added. He further said, "I started pulling a truck. I used to pull a truck for around 8 km."

262.title: Hyd-based devotee donates gold band worth ₹2 cr to Shirdi Saibaba Temple
262.article_body: A Hyderabad-based devotee has donated a band made of 4 kg of gold worth ₹2 crore to the Saibaba Temple in Maharashtra's Shirdi, the temple authorities said on Wednesday. The devotee, Parthsarthi Reddy, wished to donate the band for the throne of Saibaba's idol at the temple in 2016, but the procedure got delayed, the authorities added.

263.title: 'Narco tunnel' with a rail line uncovered between Mexico & US
263.article_body: US anti-narcotics agents have discovered a "narco tunnel" running from Mexico's Tijuana to a warehouse in US' San Diego. The tunnel, estimated to be about 1,744 feet long, had a rail track, electricity and a ventilation system. The agents were carrying out surveillance at a property previously used as a stash house for smuggling cocaine when they made the discovery.

264.title: Bus CCTV camera captures moment 2 buses collide head-on in Tamil Nadu, 30 injured
264.article_body: Around 30 people were injured in a head-on collision between two buses in Tamil Nadu's Salem district. The footage from the CCTV camera installed inside one of the buses, showing the collision, has gone viral. The video shows the bus driver thrown out of his seat while another man is seen hitting the windshield of the bus after the crash.

265.title: Anurag had told me 'Stop doubting yourself, you're good': Fatima on self-doubt
265.article_body: Actress Fatima Sana Shaikh said that filmmaker Anurag Kashyap told her to "stop doubting" herself during the film 'Ludo'. "Dada had given me some sense of confidence...He used to tell me...you're good," she said, adding that she had self doubt during 'Modern Love: Mumbai', but director Shonali Bose said she was doing well.

266.title: Painting exchanged for cheese sandwich sold at auction for over ₹2 crore in Canada
266.article_body: A Canadian painting by artist Maud Lewis has been sold at an auction for CA$350,000 (over ₹2 crore) after coming to its owner in exchange for a grilled cheese sandwich. The painting was acquired by a chef named Irene Demas in the year 1973. "Mind you...It was a great sandwich, with a five-year-old cheddar and beautiful bread," Demas said.

267.title: Bus rams into truck on Yamuna Expressway in UP; 3 killed, 36 injured
267.article_body: A bus carrying 60 people rammed into a truck on the Yamuna Expressway in Uttar Pradesh's Mathura leaving three dead and injuring 36 others, police said. The passengers were returning to Delhi after offering prayers in Vrindavan, police added. The bus rammed into the truck laden with building material from behind, police further said.

268.title: US planning military aid package for India to reduce India's dependence on Russia: Report
268.article_body: US is preparing a military aid package for India to reduce the country's dependence on Russian weapons, according to a report quoting people familiar with the matter said. The package under consideration would include foreign military financing of as much as $500 million, the report added. However, it is unclear when the deal would be announced.

269.title: 2 labourers found dead at pipeline work site amid heavy rain in B'luru
269.article_body: Two labourers were found dead amid heavy rainfall at a pipeline work site in Bengaluru's Ullal on Wednesday. "The dead have been identified as Devbharath from Bihar and Ankit Kumar from Uttar Pradesh. The labourers were at the site...around 7 pm, the water levels rose," police said. Heavy rain has led to water-logging in several parts of the city.

270.title: Demolition drive underway in Delhi's Kalyan Puri, AAP MLA Kuldeep Kumar detained
270.article_body: Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) MLA Kuldeep Kumar was detained by Delhi Police during a protest against the anti-encroachment drive of East Delhi Municipal Corporation in the Kalyan Puri area on Wednesday. Visuals from the drive, which is underway, showed shops being demolished. Delhi government has sought a detailed report from the civic bodies over the 'bulldozer' drive from April 1.

271.title: Protesting is farmers’ right but sloganeering isn’t the way: Punjab CM
271.article_body: Following a protest held by Punjab farmers near the Chandigarh-Mohali border on Tuesday, CM Bhagwant Mann said that it’s their right to protest but sloganeering is not the way to do so. "I'll make everything right...I am ready to meet them (farmers) but 'murdabad' (sloganeering) is not the way...At least put in efforts," Mann added.

272.title: The journey has been far from smooth: Bezos on 25 yrs of Amazon's IPO
272.article_body: Amazon's Jeff Bezos shared a throwback picture of himself on social media on the occasion of 25 years of Amazon's IPO, saying the journey has been far from smooth. He also specified that the IPO share price was $1.50 on Twitter. "Lots of risk-taking, lots of invention, lots of mistakes, so much we still have to do better," he added.

273.title: BMC trims over 49,000 trees as part of pre-monsoon work
273.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) trimmed more than 49,167 trees as part of its pre-monsoon work this year after surveying around 1.50 lakh roadside trees. The civic body in its survey found that 1.02 lakh trees are in a dangerous condition. The trimming of the remaining trees will be completed before the monsoon using advanced machines, BMC officials said.

274.title: Canada bans entry of Putin, 1,000 other Russians over Ukraine war
274.article_body: Canada has announced a ban on the entry of Russia's President Vladimir Putin and 1,000 other Russian nationals in the country over the Ukraine war. Canadian Minister of Public Safety Marco Mendicino on Tuesday said, "In the face of the Putin regime's brutal attack, Canada stands with Ukraine and we will hold Russia accountable for its crimes."

275.title: Stopped from taking gun to fields for scaring cattle, UP man kills brother
275.article_body: A man killed his elder brother in Uttar Pradesh's Bijnor after the latter stopped him from taking a gun into the fields. The accused, Brajveer, wanted to take his licensed double-barrel gun to the fields to scare away stray cattle. After being stopped, he got into an altercation with his elder brother and ended up firing at him.

276.title: Bengaluru Police recover 725-gram stolen gold; arrest 2
276.article_body: Police have arrested two people wanted in a theft case in Bengaluru and recovered 725 grams of stolen gold ornaments. North East Division Deputy Commissioner of Police, Anoop A Shetty, took to Twitter and congratulated the Amruthahalli Police for solving the case. Separately, the Amruthahalli Police have arrested two people involved in pickpocketing and robbing mobile phones from bus passengers.

277.title: Man held in Punjab for helping terror suspects to get fake RCs
277.article_body: A man was arrested from Punjab’s Kharar for allegedly helping some suspected Khalistani terrorists, who have been arrested, to procure fake registration certificates (RCs) for two stolen vehicles. The accused along with his associate, who was arrested earlier, used to purchase the vehicle from a third accused and they had sold two vehicles to the terror suspects.

278.title: Kane Williamson to miss rest of IPL 2022 for birth of his second child
278.article_body: SRH captain Kane Williamson will miss the rest of the IPL 2022 as he is exiting the bio-bubble to return to New Zealand for the birth of his second child. "Here's everyone at the #Riser camp wishing Kane Williamson and his wife a safe delivery and a lot of happiness," SRH posted on social media.

279.title: Hyd Police arrests Nigerian man for cheating women on matrimonial site
279.article_body: Hyderabad's Rachakonda Police arrested a Nigerian man for cheating women on an international matrimonial site. The 24-year-old accused, who impersonated himself as a non-resident Indian (NRI) and cheated women, was arrested from Delhi following a complaint lodged in Rachakonda, police added. The accused contacted the complainant stating that he was an NRI and wanted to marry her, police stated.

280.title: Malayali vlogger Rifa Mehnu died by suicide, autopsy report suggests
280.article_body: The autopsy report of Malayali vlogger Rifa Mehnu, whose body was exhumed after her family raised doubts over her death, has suggested her death was caused by suicide. The 20-year-old vlogger was found dead in her house in Dubai by her husband Mehnu (Mehnaz) in March. "Police would proceed with the investigation into the case registered against Mehnaz," police said.

281.title: PhonePe to acquire WealthDesk, OpenQ, reportedly for $70 million
281.article_body: PhonePe has said it will acquire wealth tech platforms WealthDesk and OpenQ. The acquisitions together will amount to around $70 million, media reports said. PhonePe will reportedly buy WealthDesk for roughly $50 million. WealthDesk's founder and the entire team will be working as a part of PhonePe and it will continue to remain an open platform for all players.

282.title: Finland and Sweden formally apply to join NATO amid Russia's invasion of Ukraine
282.article_body: Amid Russia's invasion of Ukraine, Finland and Sweden on Wednesday formally applied to join the North Atlantic Treaty Organisation (NATO). "This is a historic moment, which we must seize," NATO Secretary-General Jens Stoltenberg said. "You are our closest partners, and your membership in NATO will increase our shared security," Stoltenberg added.

283.title: Class 12 boy stabs friend to death in Tamil Nadu for repeatedly calling him 'girlish'
283.article_body: A Class 12 student stabbed his friend to death in Tamil Nadu's Kallakurichi district for repeatedly calling him 'girlish'. Police said that the victim continuously teased his classmate over his looks despite the latter's objection. Police registered a case of murder and sent the accused to a correctional centre. The accused also claimed the victim used to touch him inappropriately.

284.title: Actress Ketaki Chitale sent to 14-day judicial custody over post on Sharad Pawar
284.article_body: Thane court has sent Marathi actress Ketaki Chitale to 14-day judicial custody after her police custody ended. Ketaki had been arrested for allegedly sharing a derogatory post against NCP chief Sharad Pawar. She had claimed that Pawar was corrupt and had remarked upon his illness, appearance and voice in a Facebook post.

285.title: Supreme Court allows OBC reservation in local elections in Madhya Pradesh
285.article_body: Supreme Court on Wednesday allowed the Madhya Pradesh government to implement Other Backward Classes (OBC) reservation in local body elections in the state. The court further directed the state Election Commission to notify the local body elections in one week. MP government had sought a 35% reservation for OBCs in the three-tier panchayat and urban local body polls.

286.title: We'll adapt the story to modern times: Producer Murad on Tezaab's remake
286.article_body: Film producer Murad Khetani, who has bankrolled films like 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2' and 'Thadam' Hindi remake, has acquired the rights of the N Chandra directorial 'Tezaab'. According to reports, Murad will soon begin the pre-production work on the 'Tezaab' remake. Speaking about it the producer said, "We will adapt the story to modern times." The film was released in 1988.

287.title: Security tightened at Aurangzeb's tomb after MNS says it should be destroyed
287.article_body: The Maharashtra government ordered deployment of additional security outside Aurangzeb's tomb in Aurangabad after MNS leader Gajanan Kale called for destroying it. Kale also criticised AIMIM leader Akbaruddin Owaisi for visiting the tomb and said, "The Maharashtra government should take action against Owaisi...If no action is taken, then the MNS will take the matter into its own hands."

288.title: Unfollowing Kangana: Payal Rohatgi in Instagram note after losing 'Lock Upp'
288.article_body: Actress Payal Rohatgi, after losing the reality show 'Lock Upp', took to Instagram to share a note, saying that she is "unfollowing Kangana". "Kangana and lot of A-grade celebrities who came as guests on 'Lock Upp' called me bad**s...Maybe they didn't know...the meaning of it...in middle of the show and on finale Kangana realised it," she wrote.

289.title: Narine is tried and tested option as opener for KKR: Pragyan Ojha
289.article_body: Ahead of KKR's last league match of IPL 2022, ex-India spinner Pragyan Ojha said Sunil Narine should open for KKR in the absence of Ajinkya Rahane. "Narine is a tried and tested option...at the top of the order. He is an attacking option. With that you can pick a player in the middle order as a dynamic option," Ojha explained.

290.title: Man accused of robbery surrenders with 'don’t shoot me' placard in UP
290.article_body: An alleged robber surrendered to police in UP's Budaun with a "don't shoot me" placard hung around his neck, an official said. The man along with his accomplice purportedly robbed a trader of ₹5 lakh. He approached the police station with the placard reading "Don't shoot me, I am surrendering due to the fear of police," a police official said.

291.title: Indrani granted bail in daughter Sheena's murder case, SC says 'Already spent 6.5 yrs in jail'
291.article_body: The Supreme Court has granted bail to Indrani Mukerjea, the prime accused in the case involving her daughter Sheena Bora's murder, saying that she has "already spent 6.5 years in jail". In December 2021, Mukerjea wrote a letter to the CBI claiming that Sheena is alive and is in Kashmir. The CBI had refuted the former media executive's claim.

292.title: Whenever India faced challenges, Cong leaders were enjoying abroad: Hardik Patel
292.article_body: Gujarat Patidar leader Hardik Patel, who quit Congress on Wednesday, said, "Whenever our country faced challenges and when the Congress needed leadership, Congress leaders were enjoying abroad." He added, "Whenever I met with the senior leadership, I always felt leaders were...more engrossed in what messages they had received on their mobile."

293.title: Hoax bomb call delays Gorakhpur-Bandra Humsafar Express by over 3 hours
293.article_body: The Gorakhpur-Bandra Humsafar Express (19092) was delayed by three and a half hours on Tuesday after it received a hoax bomb call on Twitter. A person identified as Milan Rajak tweeted that terrorists have planted a bomb inside the train to blow it up. However, after a thorough search, nothing incriminating was found on the train, the railway police informed.

294.title: ‘Return empty beer bottles’: Brewers in Germany flag shortage
294.article_body: Germany is facing a shortage of beer bottles, brewers in the country have warned. The chief executive of a German brewers' group, Holger Eichele, said the situation is extremely tense and that "we will see shortages by summer at the latest". Eichele advised the consumers to return the empty beer bottles as soon as possible to ease the situation.

295.title: Musk responds after Twitter employee says 'he is special needs, he has Asperger's'
295.article_body: Elon Musk has responded after a journalist shared a video in which a Twitter employee calls the Tesla CEO "special needs" and says that he has Asperger's. "Twitter exec trashing free speech & mocking people with Asperger's," Musk wrote. "I can't even take what Musk says seriously," the employee can be heard saying in the video.

296.title: It's up to Tilak now to prove Rohit Sharma right: Gavaskar
296.article_body: Ex-India captain Sunil Gavaskar has said it's up to Tilak Varma to prove Rohit Sharma right in saying that the 19-year-old could be an all-format player for Team India. "It's up to Tilak to work that little bit extra, get his fitness going, get a little tighter as far as the technique is concerned and prove Rohit right," stated Gavaskar.

297.title: 1 dead after fire breaks out at banquet hall in Delhi's Ashok Vihar
297.article_body: At least one person died after a fire broke out at a banquet hall in Delhi's Ashok Vihar on Tuesday, police said. The victim was found unconscious and was declared dead at a hospital. "A fire that started at the ground floor of the banquet hall in PS Bharat Nagar area has been contained promptly," Delhi Police tweeted.

298.title: Send sweets to Mohan Bhagwat during his stay in WB: Mamata to police
298.article_body: Ahead of RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat's West Bengal visit, CM Mamata Banerjee directed the police to remain vigilant and ensure that no riots break out during his stay. "Send him sweets and fruits on behalf of the administration. He should feel that we welcome our guests," Banerjee further said. Bhagwat will be staying in West Bengal's Keshiary for four days.

299.title: Racket providing fake educational certificates busted in Panipat, 1 held
299.article_body: A racket providing fake educational certificates was busted in Panipat, following which one member of the gang was arrested by the Crime Investigation Agency of the Panipat Police. The accused told the police that he was running this racket for the past five years. The gang members used to get a certificate for classes 10 and 12 at ₹5,000.

300.title: Is this legit: Musk on Twitter engineer's 'free speech' leaked recording
300.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk reacted to the leaked recording of a top Twitter engineer saying the platform does not believe in free speech, saying, "Is this legit?" The video also showed Siru Murugesan saying Twitter employees "hated" Musk's $44 billion takeover bid. Responding to Musk, American columnist Benny Johnson claimed Twitter has acknowledged that the video is authentic.

301.title: I don't believe I'm hated; people are obsessed with me: Kangana on trolls
301.article_body: When asked about dealing with trolls and hatred, actress Kangana Ranaut said that she doesn't feel she is hated at all. "I find it very hard to believe that I might be hated," she said. "It's...difficult for me to believe. Either they love me, or they are obsessed. I don't think I'm hated as such," she added.

302.title: Tanker carrying chemical overturns, rams into divider in Thane; 2 injured
302.article_body: A tanker that was carrying 10 tonnes of chemical overturned in Thane after the driver reportedly lost control of the vehicle. The tanker then rammed into a divider. Two people were injured in the incident. Reports said that after the vehicle overturned, the chemical spilled over the road, causing traffic congestion on the Western Expressway Highway.

303.title: Burqa-clad terrorist attacks newly opened wine shop in J&K's Baramulla
303.article_body: A burqa-clad terrorist riding pillion on a bike that stopped near a newly opened wine shop in Jammu and Kashmir's Baramulla walked towards the shop and threw a grenade inside through the porthole window. The explosion killed one employee, leaving three others injured. They were rushed to a hospital. Police have cordoned the area and a search is on.

304.title: New York City raises COVID alert from 'medium' to 'high' as cases rise
304.article_body: Amid rising COVID-19 cases, New York City has raised its COVID-19 alert level from "medium" to "high". The rating means there is a high COVID-19 community spread in the city and pressure on the health care system is substantial.  Health authorities have advised New Yorkers to wear a face mask in all public indoor settings and crowded outdoor spaces.

305.title: Indian Army launches rescue operations in flood-hit  Assam
305.article_body: The Indian Army on Tuesday launched rescue operations in various parts of Assam's flood-hit Cachar and Hojai districts. "Security forces comprising of Army & Assam Rifles of Masimpur launched...rescue operations...on 17 May. Approximately, 500 villagers were rescued by the forces," Guwahati's Defence PRO tweeted. Meanwhile, around 100 people were rescued from the Hojai district by Gajraj Corps.

306.title: Yamuna water level 5.5 ft below normal, Delhi minister reviews situation
306.article_body: Water level in Yamuna was recorded at 669 feet on Tuesday at Delhi's Wazirabad barrage. This is 5.5 feet below the desired level of 674.5 feet. Delhi Water Minister Satyendar Jain carried out an on-site review of situation on Tuesday. "Due to...Haryana government's insufficient water release...water level at Wazirabad barrage has dropped from...its typical 674.5 feet to...669 feet," Jain said.

307.title: SC orders release of Rajiv Gandhi assassination convict Perarivalan after 31 yrs in jail
307.article_body: The Supreme Court on Thursday ordered the release of AG Perarivalan, one of the convicts in former PM Rajiv Gandhi's assassination case. A bench of Justices L Nageswara Rao, BR Gavai and AS Bopanna passed the order on Perarivalan's plea seeking the suspension of his life sentence. AG Perarivalan had been behind bars for around 31 years.

308.title: Hardik Patel quits Congress, says 'Party played role of roadblock on national issues'
308.article_body: Gujarat Patidar leader Hardik Patel has resigned from the primary membership of Congress party. He said, "Be it the Ram Mandir in Ayodhya, revocation of Article 370 from Jammu and Kashmir, implementation of GST - India wanted solutions...Congress only played the role of roadblock." He added, "I believe after this step, I'll be able to work positively for Gujarat's people."

309.title: What will we eat, if we won’t work: Delhi labourers amid heatwave
309.article_body: Amid the unprecedented heatwave condition in Delhi, the construction workers working in the national capital said that they have no other option except to work for their livelihood. "If I take a day off then people at home will starve. We don't have any other options except to work. I have to look after my children," a construction worker said.

310.title: Europe ditching Russian oil is economic suicide: Putin
310.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin said the EU wouldn't be able to impose a ban on Russian oil imports. "Some EU states, in whose energy balance the share of Russian hydrocarbons is especially high, won't be able to do this for...long time, to ditch our oil," Putin said. Europe would be committing an "economic suicide" by banning Russian oil, he added.

311.title: Centre pressuring states to purchase imported coal: Raj CM Gehlot
311.article_body: Centre is pressuring states to purchase imported coal, Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot alleged. The price of imported coal is more than three times the price of coal being given by Coal India Limited, he added. "Centre had issued an advisory in 2021 to Rajasthan for 4% imported coal blending...in April, it has been made mandatory to buy 10%," Gehlot added.

312.title: Spain Cabinet clears Bill to grant paid leave during menstruation
312.article_body: The Spanish Cabinet has cleared a Bill that seeks to grant paid sick leave to women experiencing pain during menstruation. "We are advancing feminism. Women should be able to decide freely about their lives," said Spanish PM Pedro Sanchez. Spain would become the first country in Europe to bring such a law, provided the Bill passes in the Parliament.

313.title: Car was badly damaged, seat belts saved us: NCP MLA after road accident
313.article_body: Nationalist Congress Party (NCP) leader, Sangram Jagtap, whose car hit a state transport bus on the Pune-Mumbai expressway on Tuesday, said that the car was "badly damaged". "Seat belts and airbags saved us," Jagtap, who was travelling with driver and two others in the car, said. He added that it was bus driver's fault but no case has been filed.

314.title: Till the second last over, I thought we had it: Rohit Sharma
314.article_body: MI captain Rohit Sharma said he thought they had the game till about the second last over of their chase of SRH's 193-run total. He added, "Credit to Sunrisers, they held their nerve pretty well at the back end." MI were 175/6 after 18 overs and needed 19 runs to win the game when Bhuvneshwar Kumar bowled a maiden over.

315.title: Understand Himachal before commenting: CM on Sisodia's 'education' remark
315.article_body: Soon after AAP's Manish Sisodia on Tuesday said the education system in Himachal Pradesh is "in shambles", CM Jai Ram Thakur told Sisodia to understand the Himalayan state before making any comment on its people or education system. Sisodia said the government schools in the state lack basic infrastructure. He added that 47% of those schools don't have a principal.

316.title: India reports 1,829 COVID-19 cases, 33 deaths in 24 hours
316.article_body: India has reported 1,829 COVID-19 cases, 2,549 recoveries and 33 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 1,569 COVID-19 cases and 19 deaths. Active cases in India stand at 15,647, while the death toll has risen to 5,24,293.

317.title: Pak influencer accused of starting forest fire as her 'Fire erupts...' video goes viral
317.article_body: A female Pakistan influencer has been criticised after she posted a TikTok video with a forest fire in background amid severe heatwave across the country. After the video, captioned "Fire erupts wherever I am", went viral, social media users said that the forest fire was started by the influencer named Humaira Asghar. However, Asghar said she didn't start the fire.

318.title: School girls in uniform fight on street in Bengaluru, pull each other's hair
318.article_body: An unverified video of a group of girls in school uniform attacking each other on the street in front of Bengaluru's Bishop Cotton Girls' School has gone viral on social media. In the video, the girls can be seen slapping each other and pulling each other's hair. One girl can also be seen taking out a stick to beat others.

319.title: Narasimha Rao brought Places of Worship Act for appeasement: BJP MLA
319.article_body: BJP MLA Brijmohan Agrawal said that the Places of Worship Act was brought by former PM PV Narasimha Rao for appeasement politics. "Lord Shiva was worshipped in Gyanvapi before 2001 but due to that Bill, namaz started happening. Even today 'Nandi Maharaj' sits in front of the mosque," said Agrawal. He also questioned Chhattisgarh government's stand on loudspeakers for azaan.

320.title: Pollution killing 90 lakh people per year, Africa hardest hit: Study
320.article_body: Pollution of all types has been causing around 90 lakh premature deaths each year since 2015, a study has revealed. The release of the study's findings reveals that overall pollution deaths haven't changed much from 2015 to 2019. The study offered a list of the 10 countries most affected by pollution-related deaths, showing Africa being the worst affected region.

321.title: How does the IPL 2022 points table read with 1 match each remaining?
321.article_body: With teams left with one match each in IPL 2022 league stage, only GT have qualified for playoffs so far. RR, LSG, DC, RCB, KKR, PBKS and SRH are in contention for remaining three playoffs spots. RR and LSG have 16 points each, while DC and RCB are on 14 points each. KKR, PBKS and SRH have 12 points each.

322.title: Mumbai Rajdhani Exp completes 50 yrs of service, to get Vande Bharat coaches
322.article_body: The Mumbai Rajdhani Express, which connects the national capital and the financial capital, completed 50 years of its journey on Tuesday. "In a few years, the train coaches will be upgraded to Vande Bharat coaches," said a senior Western Railway official. Currently, 25 pairs of Rajdhani Express trains are operational across India, the Railway Ministry stated.

323.title: Delhi govt seeks report from BJP-run civic bodies amid 'bulldozer' row
323.article_body: Delhi government has sought a detailed report from the three BJP-run Municipal Corporations of Delhi (MCDs) amid the 'bulldozer' row. Notably, various anti-encroachment drives are being conducted in the national capital by civic bodies. "More than 80% of Delhi can be called illegal and encroached upon. Does that mean you will destroy 80% of Delhi?" CM Arvind Kejriwal had said.

324.title: CBI arrests close aide of Karti Chidambaram in bribe for visa case: Report
324.article_body: The CBI has arrested S Bhaskar Raman, a close associate of Congress leader Karti P Chidambaram in an ongoing visa corruption case, reported ANI. The CBI on Tuesday raided the premises of P Chidambaram and Karti Chidambaram, alleging that the latter facilitated visas for Chinese nationals for a power project of the Vedanta Group in Punjab in return for bribes.

325.title: Will break arm of any man who raises hand at a woman: NCP's Supriya Sule
325.article_body: NCP MP Supriya Sule said that she will "break the arm" of any man who raises a hand at a woman in Maharashtra. "I will go there myself and file a case...will break his arm and hand it over to him," Sule added. This comes a day after a woman NCP worker was allegedly assaulted by BJP workers in Pune.

326.title: Demands of homebuyers, developers in Navi Mumbai to be resolved: UD Min Shinde
326.article_body: Maharashtra's Urban Development Minister Eknath Shinde said that measures have been taken to provide immediate relief to thousands of homebuyers and more than 400 affected projects in Navi Mumbai region. "There were problems faced by developers due to restrictions imposed on heights of buildings...I myself will be writing to ministry to allow building heights as per earlier CCZM," he said.

327.title: Felt that I lost respect as a housewife; decided to return to work: Neena
327.article_body: Actress Neena Gupta said she took a break from work to enjoy her married life. She added, "I got married and I thought..'I have done enough work'...But...(the people I did everything for), they didn't have time for me." Neena said she felt that she was losing respect as a housewife. "I realised I needed to work," she added.

328.title: Never thought I'll go to Cannes one day when I had started off: Nawazuddin
328.article_body: After making eight trips to the Cannes film festival in the previous years, this year for the first time actor Nawazuddin Siddiqui was invited by the Government of India to represent the country. Speaking about it, he said, "I had never thought...that I'll go to Cannes one day when I had started off." "It's the mecca of cinema," he added.

329.title: Bihar magistrate's house robbed, family assaulted at gunpoint
329.article_body: A judicial magistrate's house in Bihar was allegedly robbed and his family was assaulted at gunpoint by three armed men. Magistrate Maheshwar Nath Pandey was in court, away from home, when the incident occurred. Pandey's wife said that the perpetrators, who came looking for her husband, pulled out weapons and took away cash and jewellery.

330.title: Pune district sees 62 new COVID cases, active cases rise to 299
330.article_body: Pune district in Maharashtra on Tuesday reported 62 new cases of COVID-19, taking the number of active cases in the district to 299. Of the new cases, 52 were reported in Pune city, seven in Pimpri-Chinchwad Municipal Corporation (PCMC) limits and three in Pune rural. A total of 18.32 million COVID-19 vaccine doses have been administered in Pune.

331.title: It's nice to break the losing streak: Williamson on 3-run win vs MI
331.article_body: SRH captain Kane Williamson said it was nice to break their five-match losing streak after defeating MI. He added, "Had a few games where momentum wasn't on our side and we couldn't wrestle it back. All in all a very good performance." SRH now have 12 points from 13 games and will play their final league match against PBKS.

332.title: Netflix lays off 150 employees citing slowing revenue growth
332.article_body: Netflix has announced that it has laid off around 150 employees, mostly in the US, as it faces slowing revenue growth. "These changes are primarily driven by business needs rather than individual performance, which makes them especially tough," the firm said. The reductions come less than a month after Netflix reported its first subscriber loss in a decade.

333.title: 8-year-old boy dies due to intense heatwave in Punjab
333.article_body: An eight-year-old boy, Mehakpreet Singh, the resident of a village in Punjab's Sangrur district allegedly died after getting sick due to intense heatwave on Monday. "My son had got fever, loose motion and was vomiting. Doctors told us that he got dehydrated due to the heatwave," the deceased's father said. "However, no one provided proper treatment," he added.

334.title: Water-logging in many areas in B'luru amid heavy rains, IMD issues orange alert
334.article_body: Bengaluru witnessed water-logging in many areas amid heavy rains on Tuesday night. JP Nagar, Jayanagar, Lalbagh, Chickpet, Majestic, Malleswaram, and Rajajinagar, among others were the affected areas. Notably, the India Meteorological Department (IMD) on Tuesday issued an orange alert for urban and rural districts of Bengaluru, predicting heavy rainfall for the next four-five days in the city.

335.title: Punjab farmers protest at Chandigarh-Mohali border; CM says open to talks
335.article_body: After being stopped from entering Chandigarh, Punjab farmers sat on protest near Chandigarh-Mohali border on Tuesday. Farmer leader Jagjit Singh said protestors would break barricades and move towards Chandigarh if Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann fails to hold meeting with them by Wednesday. Mann said he's open for talks but hollow slogans cannot break his resolve to check depletion of groundwater.

336.title: Honeymoon pic of Depp with 2 black eyes shown to court, Amber Heard says 'It's photoshopped'
336.article_body: During actor Johnny Depp's defamation trial against his ex-wife Amber Heard, the court was shown a picture from the couple's honeymoon, wherein Depp was seen having two black eyes as he posed with Heard and three other men. "I've seen this picture before and he’s not injured in it. This one is photoshopped," Heard claimed.

337.title: Mame Khan becomes first folk artist to open red carpet for India at Cannes Film Festival
337.article_body: Rajasthani singer Mame Khan on Tuesday became the first folk artist to open red carpet for India at Cannes Film Festival. Khan was seen dressed in a traditional Rajasthani ensemble that included a vibrant pink kurta underneath an ethnic embroidered coat. Khan has sung for several Bollywood films like 'Luck By Chance' and 'No One Killed Jessica', among others.

338.title: Officials' immature response increased complexity in fighting COVID-19: Kim Jong-un
338.article_body: During a meeting amid the COVID-19 outbreak in North Korea, leader Kim Jong-un said that the "immaturity in the state capacity for coping with the crisis" increased the "complexity and hardships" in fighting the pandemic. North Korea has reported over 17 lakh patients with fever symptoms and 62 deaths as of Tuesday evening.

339.title: Chandigarh to get dedicated anti-narcotic task force, anti-dark net cell
339.article_body: A dedicated anti-narcotic task force will be set up in Chandigarh which will be headed by an Inspector General (IG)-rank officer. The decision was taken during the second state-level Narco Coordination Centre (NCORD) meeting chaired by UT Adviser Dharam Pal on Tuesday. A dedicated anti-dark net cell will also be constituted to check dark web drug trade in the city.

340.title: No compromise on security issues of Kashmiri Pandits: IGP Kashmir
340.article_body: Inspector-General of Police (IGP), Kashmir, Vijay Kumar on Tuesday said there will be no compromise on the security-related issues of Kashmiri Pandits. "The agenda of militants is to create fear among you. We will have to fight them jointly. If you get scared, then their agenda will get fulfilled," Kumar told the protesting Kashmiri Pandits at Sheikhpora transit accommodation.

341.title: 7 get life sentence for murder of former UP MLA, his aide
341.article_body: Seven people, including gangster Dhruv Singh alias Kuntu Singh, have been sentenced to life imprisonment in the murder of former MLA Sarvesh Singh 'Seepu' and his associate in UP's Azamgarh in 2013. A fine of ₹50,000 has also been imposed on each of them. The incident occurred over a fallout of a political rivalry, according to the prosecution.

342.title: Tesla to hold second artificial intelligence day on Aug 19: Musk
342.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has announced that the firm will be hosting its second artificial intelligence day on August 19. "The purpose of AI Day is to convince great AI/software/chip talent to join Tesla," he tweeted. The company held its first AI Day in August last year and a Battery Day in September 2020.

343.title: We didn't aim for 200 vs MI but went with the flow: SRH's Priyam Garg
343.article_body: SRH's Priyam Garg, who opened their innings along with Abhishek Sharma against MI, said they didn't plan to score around 200 runs but went with the flow. "It [was] 10-15 runs short given how we were going but it was a good score [that] our bowlers can defend," he added. SRH scored 193/6 and won the match by three runs.

344.title: Arrested for looting petrol pump, Punjab man kills self inside police station
344.article_body: A man, who was arrested by Punjab's Moga Police in a loot case, allegedly died by suicide inside the washroom of the lock-up of Baghapurana Police Station. The deceased was arrested for looting ₹17,000 from a petrol pump in December last year in Nathoke village. He was scheduled to be produced before the court on Tuesday.

345.title: Bombay HC rejects bail of man who induced friends to invest in crypto
345.article_body: The Bombay High Court rejected pre-arrest bail plea of a man accused of allegedly inducing two friends to invest ₹21.27 lakh in cryptocurrency TRON. According to the police, the accused told his friends that value of 1 TRON is equivalent to ₹10 and by investing in it they would earn a profit of 0.50% per TRON per day.

346.title: Apple delays plan to have US staff in office 3 days a week: Report
346.article_body: Apple is indefinitely delaying its plan to have US employees work from office three days a week due to rising COVID-19 cases, Bloomberg reported. It had planned for such a return starting May 23. It's still expecting US workers to come to the office two days per week. The staff is also required to wear masks in the common area.

347.title: Hyd growing not just in IT but in many sectors: T'gana minister
347.article_body: Hyderabad has been growing not just in the information technology sector but in many sectors like life sciences, aerospace and defence, Telangana Industry Minister KT Rama Rao said. "Seven years ago...two million square feet office space was getting leased out....has now reached 11 million square feet," he added. Our job as a government is to create more infrastructure, Rao stated.

348.title: Platform ticket price at Pune Railway Station increased to ₹30 till May 31
348.article_body: The platform ticket price at the Pune Railway Station has been increased from ₹10 to ₹30 till May 31. This has been done to control crowd at the platforms during summer vacation. "Our appeal to passengers and their relatives or friends, who come to drop or pick up, is to avoid crowding at the premises," Pune railway division spokesperson said.

349.title: Haven't done anything wrong, I was betrayed: Officer removed from Gyanvapi survey
349.article_body: Ajay Mishra, former advocate commissioner appointed for conducting the survey of Gyanvapi Mosque has said, "I've not done anything that reveals the secrecy of the matter." Mishra said he had been betrayed by advocate Vishal Singh who had "taken advantage of his trusting nature".
