Mishra had reportedly engaged a private person for the videography, who leaked information to the media.

350.title: We girls had male friends; they took us out, paid our bills in Delhi: Kangana
350.article_body: Actress Kangana Ranaut said that she and the other girls who lived with her in Delhi had made their male friends their drivers. "They used to take us out...they used to pay bills...for us," she said, adding that she experienced a "cultural shock" after coming to Mumbai. "In Mumbai...even if you are on date...you have to pay equal," she added.

351.title: Towing of vehicles must be re-introduced: Bengaluru's new police chief
351.article_body: Towing vehicles in no-parking zones must be re-introduced, Bengaluru's new Police Commissioner CH Pratap Reddy said. Towing must be brought because "handling traffic issues will be a challenge since people are returning to normal life after the COVID-19 pandemic", he added. Karnataka government suspended towing of vehicles in Bengaluru in February after allegations of corruption and harassment.

352.title: 3 more top Twitter employees leave ahead of Elon Musk's takeover
352.article_body: Twitter lost three more senior employees, including two vice presidents, ahead of Elon Musk's takeover. Ilya Brown, a VP of product management; Katrina Lane, VP of Twitter Service; and Max Schmeiser, head of data science, are all leaving the company, a Twitter spokesperson confirmed. Earlier, Twitter Chief Executive Officer Parag Agrawal fired two top executives.

353.title: 16-year-old fan's letter to MS Dhoni goes viral, CSK captain says 'Well written'
353.article_body: A 16-year-old fan's letter to CSK captain MS Dhoni went viral on social media. The official Twitter handle of CSK shared pictures of the framed letter. "If I am 7% the person you are someday, I'd consider myself blessed," a part of the letter read. Dhoni signed the letter, writing, "Well written. Best wishes."

354.title: Hanuman idol shifted to temple after clashes in MP's Neemuch
354.article_body: The Hanuman idol, which was placed near a dargah leading to communal clashes in Madhya Pradesh's Neemuch, has been shifted to a temple, said police. Five FIRs were registered and 10 people were detained by police on Tuesday. Several people were left injured in the clashes during which stones were pelted and a mosque was set on fire.

355.title: Anurag Thakur shares pics with Indian contingent at Cannes red carpet, calls it 'Historic'
355.article_body: Information & Broadcasting Minister Anurag Thakur walked the red carpet at 75th Cannes Film Festival with Indian delegation on Tuesday. Anurag shared pictures on Twitter, wherein he can be seen at the red carpet with Nawazuddin Siddiqui, R Madhavan and others. He called it a "historic moment" for India as it became the first country of honour at the festival.

356.title: Chinese plane carrying 132 people was intentionally crashed: Report
356.article_body: Flight data from one of the black boxes from the China Eastern Airlines jet indicates that someone in the cockpit intentionally crashed the plane, The Wall Street Journal reported citing people familiar with preliminary assessment by US officials. The aircraft crashed on March 21 in the mountains of Guangxi, killing all 123 passengers and nine crew members aboard.

357.title: 13-yr-old returning home on bicycle run over by car in Delhi, dies
357.article_body: A 13-year-old boy who was returning home on a bicycle was run over by a car in Delhi's Hauz Khas on Saturday and he died on Tuesday at a hospital, police said. The driver of the car has been arrested, police added. The deceased was with a friend and they were returning home after they went for a swim.

358.title: Musk's SpaceX poised to become most valuable US startup: Reuters
358.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk-owned SpaceX is poised to become the most valuable US startup as its valuation jumped to over $125 billion in an ongoing share sale in the secondary market, surpassing Stripe, Reuters reported. The shares jumped in valuation from October when SpaceX's shares were sold at $56 apiece. No new shares have been issued in the secondary offering.

359.title: Won't arrest doctors in kidney transplant case yet: Pune Police to HC
359.article_body: Pune Police on Tuesday told Bombay High Court that it'll not arrest the doctors named in an FIR in an alleged case of organ transplant malpractice yet. The court had asked the police why were they in such a hurry to arrest highly qualified doctors. Fifteen people, including some doctors of Ruby Hall Clinic, have been booked in this case.

360.title: SRH defeat MI by 3 runs, stay alive in IPL 2022 playoffs race
360.article_body: SRH defeated MI by three runs on Tuesday to stay alive in IPL 2022 playoffs race. SRH are eighth on the points table with 12 points. With the win, SRH ended their five-match losing streak in the tournament. Meanwhile, bottom-placed MI became the first team to record 10 losses in the tournament.

361.title: Bengaluru man claims family was left stranded by Ola cab, says 'drove to pick them up'
361.article_body: An Ola Cabs customer from Bengaluru has shared an experience his family underwent while using the service to Mysuru. "An hour and a half into the trip some rowdies come...and...threaten...driver to pay up his past instalments...else they'll confiscate the vehicle," he added. Stating that his family members were "abandoned on the highway", he said he drove to pick them up.

362.title: 'Haryana not releasing our share of water' says Delhi Minister; Haryana CM denies
362.article_body: Delhi Water Minister Satyendar Jain on Tuesday alleged Haryana government was depriving the national capital's residents of their rights by withholding water. Meanwhile, Haryana Chief Minister Manohar Lal Khattar said Delhi is being supplied its share of 1,050 cusecs of water. "On the contrary, the AAP government of Punjab is not giving Haryana's share of water," the CM further claimed.

363.title: This time we played as a team: Srikanth on India's maiden Thomas Cup win
363.article_body: Commenting on the difference between earlier Thomas Cup editions and the recent one, shuttler Kidambi Srikanth said, "This time we really played as a team [rather] than like an individual sport." He added, "We bonded really well, backed each other and really believed that we could do it." India defeated Indonesia 3-0 to win their maiden Thomas Cup on Sunday.

364.title: He's nowhere near finished article: Bishop on SRH pacer Umran Malik
364.article_body: Ex-West Indies pacer Ian Bishop praised SRH pacer Umran Mailk, saying the 22-year-old's "pace distinguishes him from every other bowler around the country and beyond now". He added, "It's been heartening watching his control improve as IPL has gone along...Malik is still a work in progress. He's nowhere near the finished article." Malik has been consistently bowling above 150 kmph.

365.title: China's 'Zero-COVID' policy is unsustainable due to Omicron: WHO
365.article_body: World Health Organization (WHO) Director-General Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus claimed that China's 'Zero-COVID' policy is unsustainable because of the highly infectious nature of the Omicron variant. "We know the virus better and we have better tools...so that's why the handling of the virus should actually be different from what we used to do at the start of the pandemic," he said.

366.title: 2 tiger cubs rescued from villagers in Madhya Pradesh's Seoni
366.article_body: Forest department officials said that two tiger cubs which were allegedly injured by angry villagers were rescued by their team in Madhya Pradesh's Seoni district. "The cubs, around 14-15 months old, might have come there to drink water. The villagers surrounded them with sticks," Chief Conservator of Forest (Seoni Circle) said. However, the official denied that the cubs were injured.

367.title: Ugandan national arrested for smuggling ₹7-crore cocaine in Mumbai
367.article_body: A Ugandan national, Brandon Sulpisious Migadde, was arrested by the Directorate of Revenue Intelligence at the Mumbai airport and cocaine worth ₹7 crore was recovered from him. Officials said that his x-ray report confirmed the presence of the foreign substances in his stomach, after which he was admitted to Sir JJ Hospital. Drugs were later recovered from him, they added.

368.title: Reliance Retail to enter beauty sector with 400 stores: Report
368.article_body: Reliance Retail is looking to enter the beauty and cosmetics segment with around 400 exclusive stores in the coming years, the Economic Times reported. The company will reportedly open two kinds of outlets, a multi-brand store modelled on Sephora and a chain of value products targeting the mass market. It'll open a high-end store, code-named Tiara, within months, ET reported.

369.title: LIC's debut 2nd-worst among 11 global companies that listed this year after raising $1bn
369.article_body: Investors of Life Insurance Corporation of India (LIC) lost over ₹50,000 crore on the stock's debut on May 17. Its first-day performance makes for the second-worst debut among 11 global companies that listed this year after raising at least $1 billion through first-time share sales. The shares ended 7.8% lower than the IPO price of ₹949 after losing 9.4% earlier.

370.title: Difference of opinion doesn't mean anything is wrong with MVA: Patil
370.article_body: Maharashtra Home Minister Dilip Walse Patil said, "Congress, NCP and Shiv Sena are working together. If there's a difference of opinion on a big or small issue, it doesn't mean there is something wrong with the Maha Vikas Aghadi." Three parties should work together to fight against BJP, he added. His comment came after Nana Patole called NCP a 'backstabber'.

371.title: BSE appoints ex-RBI Deputy Governor SS Mundra as Chairman
371.article_body: BSE Limited on Tuesday announced that its board has appointed Public Interest Director SS Mundra as the Chairman of the stock exchange. Mundra retired as Deputy Governor of RBI in July 2017 after a stint of three years. Prior to that, he was Bank of Baroda's Chairman and MD. He will replace Justice Vikramajit Sen.

372.title: RBI sold $20.1 billion in spot foreign exchange in March
372.article_body: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) sold a net $20.1 billion in the spot foreign exchange market in March to defend rupee against dollar, its monthly bulletin showed. RBI said its net outstanding forward dollar purchases rose to $65.79 billion in March compared to $49.11 billion in February. In March, the rupee hit its first record low for 2022.

373.title: Murder of Qandeel Baloch in Pak was heinous honour killing: Alankrita
373.article_body: Filmmaker Alankrita Shrivastava, who will be directing a film on late Pakistani social media star Qandeel Baloch, has said that she was shaken up when Qandeel was murdered in Pakistan. "It was a heinous honour killing...I started watching Qandeel's videos repeatedly, and I was fascinated," she added. Qandeel was strangled to death in 2016 by her brother Muhammad Waseem.

374.title: US Air Force claims it successfully tested a hypersonic weapon
374.article_body: The US Air Force on Monday claimed that it had successfully tested a hypersonic weapon. The test was conducted on Saturday off the coast of Southern California when a B-52 bomber released an Air-launched Rapid Response Weapon (ARRW), it added. The ARRW achieved "hypersonic speeds five times greater than the speed of sound", it further said.

375.title: G7 using Russia's reserves for Ukraine is outright theft: Kremlin
375.article_body: Kremlin said on Tuesday that G7 countries seizing frozen Russian reserves and spending them on behalf of Ukraine is "outright theft". Kremlin's reaction came as German Finance Minister Christian Lindner reportedly said that he's open to using funds from Russian reserves for reconstruction of Ukraine amid its invasion. Earlier, US also proposed transfer of Russian oligarchs' assets to help Ukraine.

376.title: Govt considers selling part of BPCL instead of full stake: Report
376.article_body: Centre is considering inviting bids for a 20%-25% stake in Bharat Petroleum Corp Ltd (BPCL), instead of selling its entire 52.98% holding, Reuters reported quoting government officials. The officials added that the discussions about the plan were in the early stages. Initially, the government had aimed to raise $8-$10 billion from selling its full stake in BPCL.

377.title: SA batter Zubayr Hamza suspended for 9 months for using banned substance
377.article_body: South Africa batter Zubayr Hamza has been suspended for nine months by ICC for a doping violation under the ICC Anti-Doping Code. The ban was backdated to March 22, 2022, the date Hamza accepted a provisional suspension. Hamza provided an out-of-competition sample on January 17, 2022, in which the prohibited substance Furosemide was found.

378.title: Terrorists attack newly opened wine shop in J&K, 1 worker killed
378.article_body: Terrorists hurled a grenade at a newly opened wine shop in Jammu and Kashmir's Baramulla district on Tuesday, killing one worker and injuring three others. All the four employees of the shop hailed from the Jammu division, a police spokesperson said. The area was cordoned off and a search was on to nab the culprits.

379.title: Not here to judge, will enjoy creative process: Deepika on being Cannes jury
379.article_body: Actress Deepika Padukone, speaking about being a jury member at the 2022 Cannes Film Festival, stated, "I don't think any of us have the capacity to judge...critique...or...criticise." The actress further said that she would like to enjoy the creative process. "The idea is to remind ourselves of...audience or of that young child who's grown up watching movies," Deepika added.

380.title: Pathaan's music might be biggest one coming up: Sheykhar Ravjiani
380.article_body: Music composer Sheykhar Ravjiani, speaking about working with Shah Rukh Khan, has said, "'Om Shanti Om', 'Chennai Express', 'Happy New Year', all projects done with sir are an honour to be a part of." Speaking about composing songs for 'Pathaan', he said, "This one is a big and very special one coming up...might be...biggest one coming up so far."

381.title: Won't target any community: K'taka Minister on 'anti-conversion' law
381.article_body: Karnataka Home Minister Araga Jnanendra said that "anti-conversion" law will not target any community in the state and promised a strict implementation of the law. He said, "It is in the Constitution that there can't be forced conversions. We have just brought provision for punishment in case it happens." He added the step was taken to maintain law and order.

382.title: Indonesia to end outdoor mask mandate as COVID-19 cases decline
382.article_body: Indonesia is set to lift its outdoor mask mandate from Wednesday onwards amid a "more controlled" pandemic situation, President Joko Widodo said on Tuesday. Masks will still have to be worn indoors and on public transportation, he further said. Additionally, fully vaccinated travellers arriving in Indonesia will no longer need to undergo COVID-19 tests to enter the country.

383.title: Tom Harrison steps down as ECB CEO, to be replaced by Clare Connor on interim basis
383.article_body: Tom Harrison has announced that he is stepping down as the CEO of England and Wales Cricket Board (ECB) after seven years in the role. Clare Connor, the former England Women captain, has taken over the position on an interim basis. "I believe now is the right time to bring in fresh energy to continue this work," Harrison said.

384.title: Lack of confidence: Punjab Cong as AAP asks Centre for security help
384.article_body: Punjab Congress President Amarinder Singh Raja Warring criticised the Punjab government for seeking additional security forces from the Centre, saying AAP government lacks confidence in itself. It is also an admission of failure on the security front, Warring said. "Past experience has been bitter as the state accumulated substantial debt due to security expenses," Warring added.

385.title: Britain to end its overseas aid spending in China
385.article_body: The UK on Tuesday announced that it would end all overseas aid spending in China. "We'll work with China to tackle global challenges, but we can make a bigger difference spending UK aid where it is more needed," UK's Business Secretary Kwasi Kwarteng tweeted. The UK had spent around 13 million pounds on aid to China last year.

386.title: My sister taught Depp how to snort cocaine using tampon applicator: Heard
386.article_body: Amber Heard, who was cross-examined by ex-husband Johnny Depp's legal team in the ongoing defamation trial against her, stated that her sister Whitney Henriquez taught Depp how to snort cocaine using a tampon applicator. She was shown a picture that she clicked of cocaine lines on the breakfast table. Depp is suing Heard following her claim of surviving domestic violence.

387.title: Hope SC would do complete justice: Owaisi on Gyanvapi Mosque case
387.article_body: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi on Tuesday hoped the Supreme Court will do "complete justice" in the Gyanvapi Mosque case. This comes after SC directed the Varanasi DM to safeguard the "Shivling" reportedly found inside the mosque complex without affecting the right of Muslims to enter and worship. Furthermore, the SC has set the next date of hearing on May 19.

388.title: Growth forecast range reasonable despite monetary tightening: CEA
388.article_body: Chief Economic Advisor Dr V Anantha Nageswaran said India's growth forecast is "reasonable" despite monetary tightening. He added that global price shocks posed "upward risks to domestic inflation", which, over time and with increase in interest rates, would dampen demand and put downward pressure on energy prices. The risk of sustained high inflation "is somewhat low" in India, he said.

389.title: Uncle-aunties of Juhu gave us chocolates 'on udhaar': Zayed Khan
389.article_body: Actor Zayed Khan has recalled his childhood days when he had no money, but the "uncles" and "aunties" in Juhu gave him chocolates or ice creams "on udhaar (on loan)". He further stated, "It was a different time where people lived on trust and [goodwill]. Those were the days." The actor further revealed that he is locally nicknamed 'Jayed'.

390.title: Was typecast after 'Banoo...', producers stopped casting me: Divyanka
390.article_body: Actress Divyanka Tripathi has revealed that she was typecast after her 2006 TV show 'Banoo Main Teri Dulhann'. "I was typecast like Tulsi (Kyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi)...Parvati (Kahaani Ghar Ghar Kii). So producers stopped casting me," she stated. "They were like 'You've become like Tulsi...Parvati, so we can't cast you again, no one will see you'," she added.

391.title: Mandi traders in MP go on 2-day strike against ban on wheat export
391.article_body: Mandi traders in Madhya Pradesh have gone on a two-day strike against the sudden ban on export of wheat. "The Union government should have given time of at least 15 days before taking such a decision," Mandi Traders Association president said. Traders association added that over 3,000 trucks full of wheat from Madhya Pradesh are lined up at Mumbai port.

392.title: When we won IPL in 2014: Russell on his favourite moment with KKR
392.article_body: On being asked his favourite moment with Kolkata Knight Riders, all-rounder Andre Russell said, "When we won the IPL in 2014, that was an amazing experience." Russell has, so far, scored 330 runs and taken 17 wickets in ongoing IPL. On Saturday, Russell became the fastest batter in terms of balls faced to achieve 2000-run mark in history of IPL.

393.title: Textile units in Tamil Nadu protest amid high cotton, yarn prices
393.article_body: Textile units in Tamil Nadu's Tiruppur, Karur and Erode have shut their shops in protest against the Centre amid high cotton and yarn prices. "You could buy one kg of yarn for ₹200 around 18 months ago, whereas the same amount will now fetch only 400 gm of yarn," M Raja Shanmugam, President of Tiruppur Exporters' Association (TEA) said.

394.title: Blast in Karachi market leaves 1 dead, over 10 others injured
394.article_body: A blast in a market in Pakistan's Karachi on Monday killed one person and injured over 10 others. Notably, this is the second blast in the city within the span of a week. Condemning the attack, PM Shehbaz Sharif said that enemies of people's lives and property will be dealt with iron hands.

395.title: Those guilty will be punished: Maha Minister on NCP, BJP clash
395.article_body: After NCP and BJP workers clashed at an event attended by Union Minister Smriti Irani in Pune, Maharashtra Minister Dilip Walse Patil said the guilty will be punished, irrespective of what party they belong to. NCP also alleged that a woman party member was assaulted by BJP workers. "To beat a woman office-bearer or any woman is objectionable," he added.

396.title: Declassified photos, footage of UFOs shown at US Congress hearing
396.article_body: The US' Pentagon on Tuesday showcased declassified footage of UFOs to US Congress. It included a reflective spherical object that zoomed past an aircraft, with naval intelligence deputy director Scott Bray, saying, "We don't have an explanation for this specific object." It was the first open congressional hearing on UFOs in more than 50 years.

397.title: Russia moving nuclear-capable missiles to Finland's border, say reports
397.article_body: Russia is moving nuclear-capable Iskander missiles towards its border with Finland, after the latter announced its intentions to join NATO, reports have said. A purported video clip of the Iskander missiles moving towards Vyborg, a Russian town on the Finnish border, has also surfaced online. At least seven Iskander missiles were spotted along Vyborg, reports said.

398.title: Brian Lara shares old video of his son playing with Andrew Symonds, says 'Thank you Roy!'
398.article_body: Ex-West Indies captain Brian Lara took to Instagram to share a throwback video of his son playing with late Australia all-rounder Andrew Symonds. "Thank you Roy! I will let my son know how lucky he was that day to spend some time with you," Lara wrote alongside the video. Symonds passed away aged 46 in a road accident on Saturday.

399.title: Focus must be more on Indian cinema than fashion at Cannes: Deepika
399.article_body: Deepika Padukone said people should be talking about the celebration of Indian talent and cinema at the Cannes Film Festival. The actress added fashion is fun, however, doesn't deserve "pages and pages of news". She said, "I hope...Indian media has learned from...last experience and realises...we have the power to...change that narrative...talk about what a big moment this is for India."

400.title: Amber denies defecating in Depp's bed, says his dog had 'bowel control issues'
400.article_body: Amber Heard has denied leaving faeces in Johnny Depp's bed during the defamation trial. She further alleged that one of Depp's dogs had "eaten Depp's weed as a puppy and had bowel control issues for life". When asked if she committed any sort of prank, Amber replied, "Absolutely not...I don't think that's funny. I don't know what grown woman does."
